loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al banco Comunal Despertar y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones que la distraen mucho y los prestamos fáciles.
Maria es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 hijos estudian y uno esta preparándose para la universidad.
Maria vende ropa variada en las diferentes ferias sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo, negocio que inicio hace 1 años y le esta yendo bien. Maria solicita un crédito de 2500 soles para la compra de una congeladora, con la cual preparara postres.
Maria sueña con construir el tercer piso de su casa, su hija ingrese a la universidad y progresar.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Despertar (Wake up) Community Bank. She most enjoys the meetings and the accessible loan system. She is married and has four children, three of whom are students, and one who is preparing to go to university. Maria sells clothing in various markets, clothing which she has obtained in Lima. She also runs a restaurant in rented premises. She does this on a daily basis with help from her husband. It’s a business she started a year ago and it’s doing well. Maria is asking for a loan of 2,500 soles to buy a freezer in which she will keep desserts. Her dreams are to add a third floor to her house and to see her daughter go to university and do well in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina L. is 35 and is married with three children aged from 2 to 12. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale and has one year of experience in this business. Evelina needs a loan of WST 1,000 to rent land to raise additional crops. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or USD 125 per week) to improve and expand her business. In 2010, Evelina joined SPBD and this is her first loan with the organization. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Las Sirenitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva el nombre de las sirenitas, se decidió este poner este nombre, por que las integrantes se consideran 100% costeñas, y además querían un nombre que tuviera que ver con el mar, la historia es acerca de la señora Inés L. H. puesto que forma parte de este grupo, ella es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, Eleazar de 9 años y Néstor Daniel de 5, se dedica a la venta de colchas por catalogo.

Ella nos platica que escogió este negocio, por que se le facilita realizar esta actividad y así no tiene que descuidar  a sus hijos ya que la lleva a cabo en la misma colonia y considera que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compre de mas catálogos y mercancía como son: sabanas, edredones, rodapiés, cojines, sobré fundas y también va a comprar perfumes. 

Dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas de su comunidad, ya que ella les da la oportunidad de adquirir sus productos en pagos, para que así no se tengan que quedar sin dinero, y puedan comprar lo indispensable para su consumo diario, puesto que en otro lado tendrían que pagar de contado el articulo que adquieran.

El sueño que tiene doña Inés es le de poder ver crecer a sus hijos y con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio ayudarlos para que puedan seguir con sus estudios y tengan una carrera, y así mismo una muy buena profesión para que tengan un mejor futuro. 

Nos dice que las integrantes de su grupo son gente de mucha confianza, responsable y muy trabajadoras, ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse.

Da las gracias a los prestatarios por poner sus ojos en mujeres que luchan día a día ya que son personas muy emprendedoras y aseguran que responderán a la confianza que la empresa le esta brindando.

Las integrantes que forman parte de este grupo tan emprendedor y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
Inés L. H.-venta por catalogo (representante del grupo)
Yuridia marroquín Ramírez-polleria
Asunción P. Jiménez-bordadora
Rita mayra Dionisio P.-bordadora
Sara Juárez Gómez-tienda de ropa
Rosaelia Damián M.-materias primas
Ana Martha garcía López-materias primas
Carmen C.-deposito de refrescos
Inés Martínez Rendón-tienda de ropa
Aurelia A.-bonetería y mercería
texts.en:
This group is called Las Sirenitas (The Mermaids) because the members of the group all come from the coast and they wanted a name that showed their connection to the sea. Señora Inés L. H. is a member of the group. She is a single mother of two children, Eleazar aged 9 and Néstor Daniel aged 4. Her job is selling bed covers from a catalog. She chose this business because it fits in with family life, she doesn’t have to neglect her children, and the work is near where she lives. Inés believes it is a very good way of earning a living. The loan she receives will be used to buy more catalogs and merchandise such as sheets, quilts, baseboards, cushions, pillow covers, and perfumes. Inés says that her business is greatly benefitting the people in her community since she gives them the chance to buy her products on a payment plan so they don’t have to be without money. They can buy what they need in installments. Her dream is to see her children grow up and to be able to use the profits from her business to help them continue with their education and get good jobs so they will have a bright future. Inés notes that the people in her group are confident, responsible, and very hardworking, and they have got to know each other well. She is grateful to the donors for putting their trust in these women who struggle to make ends meet every day. The following people are part of the group:  Inés L. H.--catalog sales (group representative)  Yuridia Marroquín Ramírez--poultry store  Asunción P. Jiménez--embroiderer  Rita Mayra Dionisio P.--embroiderer  Sara Juárez Gómez--clothes store  Rosaelia Damián M.-raw materials  Ana Martha garcía López-raw materials  Carmen C.--soft drinks stand  Inés Martínez Rendón--clothes store  Aurelia A.--sewing and notions shop

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sheets, quilts etc.

loans.name: Lematea

texts.en:
Lematea A. is 36 and is married with five children. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale and has many years of experience in this business.

Lematea needs a loan of WST 750 to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxone. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or approximately USD 193 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2008, Lematea joined SPBD and this is her 3rd loan with the organization. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.


About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join  SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxone

loans.name: Itacuan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Itacuan, por que en la localidad donde viven se cosecha la flor de itacuan, esta historia es acerca de Lidia Roberta C. M. ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Frida de 3 años y Beltrán de 1 año de edad, Lidia tiene una tienda de abarrotes.

Nos comenta que escogió poner esta tienda, por que su localidad es muy pequeña y debido a que no hay mas negocios de este tipo en la comunidad, aparte de que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, ya que deja buenas ganancias puesto que es la única tienda de abarrotes ahí, con el préstamo que recibió piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercancía para surtir bien su negocio como: refrescos, sopas, jabón, aceite, fríjol, arroz, azúcar y sal, ya que es lo que mas vende.

Ella dice que con su negocio esta beneficiando mucho a las personas de su comunidad, ya que antes de que ella abriera su tienda de abarrotes las personas tenían que ir al pueblo vecino por los productos que nesecitaban, pero ahora ya no tienen que salir tan lejos y se ahorran tiempo y dinero. 

La meta que tiene doña Lidia es la de hacer crecer mas su tienda para así poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una buena profesión y un  muy buen futuro.

Lidia dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo son personas muy trabajadoras, responsables y puntuales a la hora de realizar sus pagos, ya que los conoce de hace tiempo y no les gusta defraudar a quienes les brindan su ayuda.

Le da las gracias a los prestatarios y a kiva por la confianza que le están dando a ella y a su grupo, ya que con su apoyo están pudiendo sacar adelante sus negocios y mas que nada a sus familias que son las que más necesitan esta ayuda.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de Itacuan y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes.
Lidia Roberta C. M.-tienda de abarrotes (REPRESENTANTE)
Heriberta Rafaela R. Rivero-venta de quesos
Emma Sánchez R.-polleria
Francisca Sánchez González-tienda de abarrotes
Elizabeth soledad M. M.-zapatería
Carmen C. M.-cocina económica
Justina C. M.- venta de quesos
Eufemia Inés M. M.-polleria
Araceli R. López-polleria
Luisa Sánchez S.-polleria
Maria del carmen Sánchez López-pescadería.
texts.en:
The Itacuan group chose this name because the itacuan flower is grown in their region. Lidia Roberta C. M. is the representative of the group. She is married and has two children, 3-year old Frida and 1-year old Beltrán. She has a grocery store. Lidia chose this line of work because the town is very small and so there are no other businesses of this kind in the community. As well, it provides a good income. With the loan she plans to buy more merchandise for her store such as soft drinks, soups, soap, oil, beans, rice, sugar, and salt as these are the items most in demand. Lidia says that her business has greatly benefitted the people in the community as beforehand they had to go to the nearby town to buy the things they needed. Now they don’t have to go as far so they save time and money. Her goal is to expand her business so she can continue supporting her children while they get their education. They will then be able to get good jobs and have a bright future. Lidia says that the people in her group are hardworking, responsible, and punctual when the time comes to make their repayments. She has known them for a long time and knows they will not try to cheat anyone who offers them help. She is grateful to the donors and to Kiva for the trust they are putting in her and the other group members. With this help they can improve their businesses as well as help their families who are very needy. The following people belong to the Itacuan group:  Lidia Roberta C. M.-grocery store (group representative)  Heriberta Rafaela R. Rivero-cheese stall  Emma Sánchez R.-poultry stall  Francisca Sánchez González-grocery store  Elizabeth soledad M. M.-shoe stall  Carmen C. M.-small restaurant  Justina C. M.- cheese stall  Eufemia Inés M. M.-poultry stall  Araceli R. López-poultry stall  Luisa Sánchez S.-poultry stall  Maria del Carmen Sánchez López-fish stall

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, sugar etc

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega es un grupo muy alegre y solidario el nombre lo escogieron entre todas las integrantes del grupo por que comenta que en la biblia sagrada habla sobre Alfa y Omega en este grupo son 9 integrantes de las cuales todas estan en la foto la representante del grupo es la señora:Teodora T. H. ella se dedica ala venta de comida economica cuenta con 40 años de edad tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno depende de ella,vive en union libre comenta que su credito lo utilizara para poder comprar los productos que le hacen falta para negocio como son:M.,quezo entre otros productos mas tambien vende cosmeticos.
Las demás integrantes son:
Juana S. M. vende por catalago,
Avelina M. P. vende comida economica,
Maria G. Esleva vende Chiles y semillas,
Rosalba D. G. venta de ropa,
Lorena L. R. venta de antojitos,
Irma S. C. venta de Tacos,
Veronica G. T. venta de zapatos por catalago,
Olga Lidia V. G. ella teje manteles servilleteros y comenta que ella les enseño a su hijo y a su esposo a tejer; su hijo tambien le gusta tejer cojines,servilleteros entre o tras cosas y su esposo le ayuda cuando ella tiene mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Alfa y Omega” (Alpha and Omega) is a cheerful and close-knit group. The group name was chosen by all the members because of the reference in the Bible to Alpha and Omega. There are nine members in the group and all of them appear in the photograph. Sra. Teodora T. H. is the group representative and has a business selling affordable food. She is 40 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children who are all independent. Teodora says her loan will be used to buy products that she is lacking in her business such as cornmeal and cheese. The other members are as follows: • Juana S. M. sells cosmetics through catalogs. • Avelina M. P. sells affordable food. • Maria G. Esleva sells chili peppers and seeds. • Rosalba D. G. sells clothing. • Lorena L. R. sells snacks. • Irma S. C. sells tacos. • Veronica G. T. sells shoes through catalogs. • Olga Lidia V. G. weaves tablecloths and napkins. Olga says she taught her son and her husband how to weave. They enjoy making items such as floor pillows, napkins, and other products. Her husband helps whenever there is large workload. Adriana V. M. and Emilia Montiel Murillo were not present to sign the contract, so their loans were canceled.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients such as cornmeal and cheese

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su madre y dos hermanos en el caserío Hornitos una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
 
Se ha dedicado desde que era muy joven a criar animales en casa de su madre para venderlos a los negociantes de la zona y desde hace más de tres años empezó a comercializarlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella cría pavos, patos, cuyes y carneros hasta que ya han alcanzado un desarrollo correcto. Usualmente viaja dos veces por semana a la ciudad para ofrecerlos en venta. 

Dominga trabaja arduamente para porgresar y sacar adelante a su familia, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación su negocio ha ido creciendo con el tiempo y cada vez su demanda aumenta, actualmente ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas animales para seguir adelante con su negocio de crianza y venta.

Dominga ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva con un préstamo otorgado por medio de Nuestra Institución, ella se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella y su negocio. Por ahora su sueño es seguir creciendo para brindarle a los suyos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dominga is 44 years old, single, and lives with her mother and two siblings in the village of Hornitos. This rural area is part of the district of Mórrope in Lambayeque Province and is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Ever since she was a young woman, Dominga has been raising animals at her mother’s house and selling them to local merchants. Three years ago, she began selling them in the city of Chiclayo. She raises turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs, and sheep until they reach the right stage of development. Dominga usually travels twice a week into the city in order to sell her animals.

Dominga has worked hard to make progress and move her family forward. With great effort and dedication, she has grown her business over time and has been able to create more demand. She is currently requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of more animals to raise and sell. This will allow her to continue her business.

Dominga received a previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa. She is very grateful to everyone who helped her with her business. Right now her dream is to continue growing so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals

loans.name: Entrada Chunazana  ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada Chunazana está conformado por 12 mujeres luchadoras que buscan  mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, viven en el cantón de Nabon que está ubicado al Sur-Este de la provincia del Azuay, caracterizándose por su clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, y la producción de la agricultura es para su autoconsumo, su gente es luchadora y muy trabajadora.

La Señora Emma L. vive en la comunidad de Guando loma que pertenece al cantón de Nabon, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijo de 15, 12 y 8 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio de la comunidad de Shiña y su última hija en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo trabaja como jornalero, labrando la tierra, ganándose el pan de cada día, gracias al trabajo diario y conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales como: cuyes, gallinas, borregos y ganado, vende sus animalitos cuando tiene alguna necesidad, también se dedica a trabajar en la sastrería, actividad que la realiza hace 12 años, todo lo que sabe lo a aprendido en un taller de capacitación, realizar varios tejidos como chompas, polleras (faldas), etc. trabaja desde su casa. Es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y se siente contenta ya que con los créditos puede crecer mas en su negocio, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir comprando materiales para la sastrería como: tela, hilo, etc., su meta es agrandar su casa y su taller.
 
La Señora Rosa C. vive en la comunidad de la Ramada que es perteneciente al cantón Nabon, es una mujer muy joven con apenas 23 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su primer hijo tiene 3 años 5 meses y su segundo hijo tiene 7 meses, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su suegra.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes, también siembra hortalizas en sus tierras, sus productos los vende en su comunidad y también para su consumo. Es el primer crédito que realiza, el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y semillas para continuar con su negocio de hortalizas. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Entrada Chunazana” consists of twelve strong-willed women who are looking to improve the financial stability of their households. They live in the canton of Nabon, which is located in the southeastern section of Azuay Province. The area is known for its cold climate, its residents who engage in livestock breeding, and its use of agriculture as a means of self-sufficiency. The local people are determined and hardworking.

Sra. Emma L. lives in the community of Guando Loma, which is part of the canton of Nabon. She is 34 years old, married and has three children (ages 15, 12, and 8). Her two older children attend high school in the community of Shiña, while her youngest child goes to the local elementary school. Emma’s husband is a farm laborer who works the land so that he can earn a daily wage. Together she and her husband have been able to build their own home.

Emma engages in farming and also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, sheep, and cattle, and sells them when necessary. She also works as a tailor and has been in this business for twelve years. Emma learned everything she knows by working in a small workshop. She makes various woven items at home such as sweaters and skirts. This is the first time she will receive a loan from Fundación ESPOIR and she feels happy that it will help her grow her business. The money will be invested in the purchase of materials for her tailoring business such as fabric and thread. Her goal is to expand both her house and her workshop.

Sra. Rosa C. lives in the community of La Ramada, which is part of the canton of Nabon. She is a very young woman at only 23 years of age. Rosa is married and has two children. Her oldest child is 3 years and 5 months, while her second child is only 7 months old. Rosa’s husband is an employee at a company. They do not own a home, so they live at her mother-in-law’s house.

Rosa raises chickens and guinea pigs. She also grows crops on her land and sells her products in the community, but keeps some of it for personal consumption. Rosa is also receiving her first loan and will invest the funds in compost and seeds so that she can continue her farming business. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El señor Porfirio es un hombre muy trabajador, el y su esposa se dedican a la elaboración y venta de quesos. Son una familia muy unida y tienen muchas ganas de hacer que el negocio familiar crezca y vender en mas lugares, para incrementar sus ganancias. El señor Porfirio tiene dos niños pequeños y se preocupa por su educación, el quiere formar el patrimonio de sus hijos y requiere de este crédito para la compra de mas material para elaborar los quesos, el agradece su ayuda de antemano.
texts.en:
Sr. Porfirio is a hardworking gentleman. He and his wife make and sell cheese. They are a very close family. To generate more income, Porfirio wants to grow his business and sell in more places. He has two small children and is concerned about their education and providing them with an inheritance.

Porfirio is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for making cheeses and expresses his appreciation in advance for the support.

loans.name: 03.09.19 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
"Vân N. Thị (96) is a 48 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Vân is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03.09.19 Điện Biên (19 Điện Biên).


Vân is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Vân owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  Vân has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.310.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Vân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  B. Thị Xuân (100) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


2.  Lê Thị Len (99) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Lê Thị Hoa (101) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  N. Thị Ái (162) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  Ngô Thị T. Hà (160) is a 35 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


6.  N. Thị Quỳnh (161) is a 21 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Her husband provides her wood for making the wooden stools that she needs to meet the orders of her customers.  

She is also a good mother as well. She manages the household chores and carried out the responsibilities of a mother and a housewife efficiently. She has three sons and two daughters. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints and her sons had to work to support the family during their teen-age years.  

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband expand his business. With the loan he will buy timber to fill larger orders. 

This is the 2nd loan from Asasah and she maintains a good credit behavior. She hopes that investment in her husband’s business can increase his income which will make her family’s financial life easier.

loans.use: To purchase timber for reselling

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ann S. 56 years old and she is the village bank president having been selected by fourteen members which located in Puothi Reamea, Kandal province. With the loans, the member of this village will use it’s to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose.   
Mrs. Ann S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and peanut for a living.Aside from farmer she is also pig breeder at home who is able to earn a little income to hold up her family living. In order to support this agriculture, she will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy pig food for pig breeding and to buy rice seed for cultivating rice. Mrs. Ann S. is widow with a child, who is a cloth seller in the local market.

loans.use: To buy pig food for pig breeding and to buy rice seed for cultivating rice

loans.name: Kang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kang P. is 48 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by fifteen members which located in Puothi Reamea, Kandal province. With the loans, the members hope to increase income to improve their family living.
Mrs. Kang P. and her husband, Mr. Keng Korn, are farmers who work very hard to support their family living. With their farming, they have a problem because their rice fields do not have enough water to support the rice plants. Thus, Mrs. Kang P. will use the loan that asked from AMK to buy a water machine to grow rice.  Aside from farmer, Mr. Keng Korn is also fisherman and construction worker. This couple has three children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while another one is attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine to grow rice

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor T. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a house on their own land. Her husband is a photographer. Her son, Narangerel, is 25 years old and works for a company. Her daughter, Sarangerel, is 22 years old and this year, graduated from university. Now she is helping with her mothers business. 

Dolgor currently operates a construction material and construction equipment business out of a rented stall at the largest market in Ulaanbaatar, called Khar-khorin. Since Dolgor started her business, her family's living conditions have improved. With her earnings, she has been providing money for family expenses and paying her children's education fees. Now she has 4 sales outlets for her business. She is an open and very hardworking person. She has also started to build a grocery business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase construction material to finish the grocery store and purchase current assets fo the new business.

loans.use: To start new business

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.  She is 41 years old and has struggled financially all through her life. Her husband is 60 years old and can’t work to earn income for the family. She is the mother of three sons; two of them work to financially support the family. 

Jameela makes handmade fans on order to share the financial burden of her family. These fans are famous in rural areas specifically because they face a shortage of electricity.   

She has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her son. With the loan he will buy bicycle spare parts and repair tools for his bicycle spare parts and repair shop. 

 Jameela hopes that working with Asasah for her family’s better future will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts and repair tools for a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Puong

texts.en:
Puong C., 22, weaves and sells silk cloth at her local market in Takeo province. She is married but has no children yet. Her husband, pictured here, works in a private company position as a stock manager.

Puong typically makes a combined US$6 each day. In order to increase her income, she is asking for a US$1,000 loan to build a pigpen and raise pigs.

loans.use: To build a pigpen and raise pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira G. is from the city of Rizal Santiago. She is 45 years old. Elvira is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvira operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Shiela Alona

texts.en:
Mrs. Shiela Alona R. is from the barangay (district) of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, but unfortunately separated from her husband.  She is blessed with 3 school aged children. Shiela Alona is presently engaged in fish wholesaling and retailing. She also receives support from her father, a pensioner, for other needs. Shiela Alona has been involved in this type of business for 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from this livelihood. 

In February 2010, Shiela Alona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of 10,000 PHP. She is now requesting an amount of 20,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, to be used for additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, the children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansions.

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for fish wholesaling and retailing business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has spent all her life in Borewala, which is a small city of Pakistan famous for its shrines. Her husband has a business of selling timber. She helps her husband financially by selling clothes. 

She has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. Her son had to leave his education after 8th class and started to work to support his family. He works in a carpet shop, where he deals with the customers and sells carpets to them. 

Nasreen bibi has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah to financially support her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy more timber for his timber-selling business. 

In the previous year, she has maintained good credit behavior and never gave Asasah any trouble regarding attending recovery meetings and paying back installments. She hopes that her husband will increase his income this time and also provide better facilities of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchase timber for timber-selling business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma R. is from the village of Madalag, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. Thelma owns and operates a fish selling business. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Madalag, Jose Dalan Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza Q. de 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 7, 9, y 14 años de edad, de igual forma vive junto a su madre la cual es su mano derecha tanto con el cuidado del hogar como con su trabajo. Ella vive junto a su familia en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador. Zoila  es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, que ha pesar que desempeña tanto el rol de madre como el de padre, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ya que sus tres hijos cuentan con todo lo necesario y así mismo se dedican a estudiar gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de Loida. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan y golosinas, y también   de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo, así mismo elabora tortillas cada mediodía y también comercializa verduras a las afueras de su casa, su madre le ayuda a atender los negocio y así mismo a hacer las tortillas, y es así como gracias al esfuerzo de ambas poseen sus negocios de manera muy estable. Loida solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, y verduras, de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila Esperanza Q. is 44 years old and lives with her three children (ages 7, 9, and 14). Her mother also lives with them and acts as her right hand when taking care of the home and managing her business. Zoila and her family reside in Tonacatepeque, which is located in the city of San Salvador. She is a responsible and hardworking mother. Even though she must assume the role of both father and mother, she has been able to move her family forward and provide everything her children need for their studies. All of this has been made possible thanks to Zoila’s tremendous efforts. She has a store where she sells food products such as bread and candy. Her inventory also includes basic necessities such as soap and shampoo. She also makes tortillas every day at noon and sells vegetables outside of house. Her mother helps with managing the business and making tortillas. Their efforts have helped her businesses remain stable.

Zoila is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store, as well as buy corn in bulk and vegetables so that she can provide better service to her customers. To help her family succeed, she seeks to improve her sales as a priority.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store; acquire corn in bulk & vegetables

loans.name: Rosenita Malinao's Group

texts.en:
Rosenita M. is from the village of San Isidro, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Rosenita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosenita M.'s Group.

Rosenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosenita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,300 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rosenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rosenita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosenita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao P., 48, is married and lives with her three children in the Takeo province. (Sao P. and her husband were not available for the picture, so one of their children is pictured instead.) She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband works in private security, making $3 each day. Three of her children are construction workers, building houses. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sao P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work. This will allow her children to reduce their transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is from the village of Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married and has 8 adult-aged children.

To make a living, Rosalinda runs a butcher shop. She has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosalinda joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which she used as additional capital.

Rosalinda is requesting her fourth loan, for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As addtional capital for her business.

location.town: Poblacion, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Being a mother at the age of 19, Maricar E. is really doing her best to provide for the needs of her infant child.To make a living, Maricar raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maricar has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) whenever she sells a raised animal. Maricar's family is living in the city of Rizal Santiago. In 2010, Maricar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Maricar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda G. T. de 34 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Metapán, el cual se encuentra en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores de edad y quienes se dedican a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a su esposo y su madre. Imelda elabora y comercializa pupusas las cuales vende en su casa de habitación y en donde trabaja junto a su madre, esto lo realiza con el deseo de poder brindarle una ayuda económica a su esposo y con el fin de que no les haga falta lo más necesario para contar con una vida digna. Imelda es una mujer muy responsable, quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por ser alguien amable y trabajadora que siempre esta a la brecha por el bienestar de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a integral con el deseo de mejorar su negocio, comprando maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar bebidas gaseosas, queso, chicharrón, frijoles y arroz para la elaboración de las pupusas, y así de esta forma contar con mayor cantidad de materia prima para hacer más pupusas e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Imelda G. T. is 34 years old and resides in the town of Metapán, which is part of the departmental capital of Santa Ana. She lives with her four school age children, her husband, and her mother. Imelda prepares pupusas and sells them out of her home. She works alongside her mother so that they can help her husband with generating financial resources to provide the most basic necessities and live a decent life. Imelda is a very responsible woman and has excellent references who describe her as a kind and hardworking individual who always provides for the welfare of her family.

She is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can improve her business. Imelda will buy corn in bulk as well as sodas, cheese, pork, beans, and rice for making pupusas. She hopes to be stocked with a large quantity of ingredients so that she can make more pupusas and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making "pupusas"

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es: María del Socorro F. M. de 56 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, lugar en el cual realiza parte de su trabajo, vive junto a su esposo de 66 años de edad quien le brinda su ayuda en la venta, y junto a cuatro hijos de 19,14, 8 y 6 años de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela del lugar en el que habitan. María se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, tales como jeans, camisas y blusas para dama, ella la comercializa en su hogar y así mismo día con día sale a venderla por diferentes puntos clave de Santa Tecla, entre los cuales están los parques y las afueras de mercado y zonas muy concurridas. Desde hace 4 años que ella trabaja junto a su esposo de esta manera y ambos se esfuerzan mucho por obtener mayores ganancias, así mismo cuentan con diferentes clientes los cuales les compran ropa con mucha frecuencia ya que ellos la comercializan a muy buenos precios los cuales son muy accesibles para la mayoría de personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar diferentes tallas de ropa, y de esta forma mejorar sus ventas y así mismo salir adelante junto a su familia, ya que esto lo que beneficia en primer lugar es a sus hijos, ya que le permite brindarles todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
María del Socorro F. Martinez is 56 years old and resides and works in Santa Tecla. She lives with her husband, who is 66 years old and helps with making sales. They have four children (ages 19, 14, 8, and 6) who attend the local schools. María sells clothing for men, women, and children such as jeans, shirts, and blouses. She sells her products from home and also at different locations throughout Santa Tecla such as parks, outside of the market entrances, and other places that experience heavy traffic. María and her husband have been in business for four years and are striving to earn more income. They have different types of customers who buy clothes from them on a frequent basis because they offer good prices that are affordable for most people.

María is requesting a loan so that she can buy different sizes of clothing. This will allow her to increase her sales and move her family forward. Most of all, her children will be the primary beneficiaries since she will be able to provide them everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in different sizes

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila R. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Prescila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Silvia Morena

texts.es: Silvia Morena S. C. de 30 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, la cual desea poder ampliar su negocio, incrementado la cantidad de variedad de productos. Ella vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa privada, así mismo vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 13, 7 y 4 años de edad. Silvia posee una venta de cosméticos, cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, perfumes, lociones, shampoo, colas para el cabello y ganchos. Su negocio esta ubicado a las afueras del mercado municipal de Izalco, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate, en donde cuenta con muy buena ubicación debido a que muchas personas prefieren comprarle a ella sus productos en lugar de entrar al mercado, esta es una zona muy transitada durante todo el día y sobretodo en los fines de semana en donde sus ventas se incrementan. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, aumentando la cantidad de maquillajes y de esta forma ofrecer diferentes precios, así mismo comprar cremas para el cuerpo, lo cual es lo que posee mayor cantidad de demanda. Esto llena de mucha ilusión ya que espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia Morena S. C. is 30 years of age and a hardworking young woman. She wants to expand her business and offer a wider variety of products. Silvia lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and their four children (ages 14, 13, 7, and 4). She has a vending post where she sells cosmetics, hair and body crèmes, perfumes, lotions, shampoos, hair extensions, and hair clips. Her business is located outside of the municipal market in Izalco, which is in the Department of Sonsonate. This is a very good location since the area is busy throughout the day and people prefer to buy products from her instead of going into the market. Her sales increase on the weekends.

Silvia is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to buy more merchandise. She wants to increase her inventory of makeup so that she can offer products at various price points. In addition, she will buy body crèmes that are in high demand. Silvia has great enthusiasm and hopes to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old and married with 6 adult-aged children.

To make a living Estrella sells fish. Estrella has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Estrella joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase additional products to sell.

Estrella is requesting her fifth loan, for 20000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business.

loans.name: 040106_Hai Son _Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hang L. T. (40107029) is a 63-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hai Son_Hoang Truong _Hoang hoa.  Hang is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa (040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa).


Hang is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Hang operates a family member's business providing new clothing services to local community members.  Hang has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Hang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hang has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Chinh (40106032) is a 44-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


2.  P. T. Toi (40106051) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


3.  N. T. Duong (40106050) is a 40-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  T. T. Thuong (40106048) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


5.  L. T. Van  (40106040) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


6.  L. P. T. Tuyet (40106039) is a 34-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.


7.  N. T. Hai Duong (40106044) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail clothing business.


8.  L. T. Sinh (40106043) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hang L. T. (40107029) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hai Son _Hoang Truong _Hoang hoa.  Hang là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa (040106_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo mới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hang thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hang kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, Hang đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hang đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita E. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual reside junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por sus dos hijos de 18 y 13 años de edad. Desde hace 10 años que Margarita se gana la vida vendiendo pupusas, almuerzos, tortillas jugos y sodas en el mercado Sagrado Corazón, uno de los mercado más grandes de la capital del país y que cuenta con una inmensa afluencia de personas a diario, ella es muy conocida en el lugar y cuenta con clientes, los cuales comen en su negocio cada día, así mismo es muy conocida por las personas que llegan a comprar al mercado las cuales compran sus productos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, quien se dedica mucho a su trabajo, elaborando comida de primera calidad y de muy buen sabor, lo cual la ha hecho tan conocida en el lugar. Es gracias a este negocio como ella ha podido sostener su hogar, ya que no posee ningún tipo de ayuda para mantener a sus hijos, los cuales se dedica a estudiar. Margarita solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, carnes, verduras, bebidas y todo lo necesario para elaborar más alimentos y de esta forma prosperar aún más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita E. is 33 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador along with her two children, ages 18 and 13. For the past 10 years Margarita has made a living selling flatbreads, lunches, tortillas, juices and sodas at the Sagrado Corazón (Sacred Heart) market, one of the biggest markets in the country's capital that sees an immense number of visitors every day. Margarita is very well known at her stand and has regular customers who eat at her business every day. She is a hard-working woman who dedicates herself to her job, making high-quality and flavorful meals that have made her so well known at her stand. It's thanks to this business that she has been able to provide for her household, since she doesn't have any other source to help out her children, who are dedicating themselves to their education. Margarita is requesting a loan so she can purchase corn, rice, cheese, beans, pork rinds, meats, vegetables, refreshments and everything else she needs to make more meals and in this way help her business prosper more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to be able to make more meals

loans.name: Celia Del Carmen

texts.es: Celia del Carmen
texts.en:
Celia is 45 years old and lives in the colony of Las Moritas D. Lourdes Colón in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her only son, who is grown up and working, and also lives with her 6-year-old grandson. Celia is single and looks out for her well-being every day. She works selling clothing for men, women and children out of her home and also travels to sell to her friends and neighbors and in the surrounding areas of Lourdes. She is a very responsible person who comes with very good references from the people closest to her. Celia is requesting a loan so she can have the necessary funds to purchase a larger quantity of clothing in different sizes, colors and styles, and in this way she can offer more items to more people, such as young people, adults and babies. This business is very important to Celia since it is her only way of making a living and grants her acceptable economic stability, which is why she really wants to be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from Barangay Dadap, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Myrna is single. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a  specialized retail store selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie V. is from the village of Burgos. He is 40 years old. Ronie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ronie raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and resale. Ronie has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Ronie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: José Aparicio

texts.es: José Aparicio G. H. 55 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La libertad. Vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, junto a una hija y una nieta. José es un señor muy esforzado quien trabaja como camionero, transportando diferentes tipos de materiales, ya sea leña, arena, incluso haciendo viajes para mudanzas, él posee dos camiones los cuales son su fuente de trabajo y gracias a los cuales cuenta con el sustento diarios, en muchas ocasiones él realiza viajes desde Opico hasta San Salvador, los cuales son los viajes en los cuales gana más. Él solicita un préstamo a integral, con el deseo de contar con el monto necesario para invertir en el mantenimiento de sus camiones, y así mandar a reparar la cama del camión y las fajas de este, esto lo hace con el fin de poder contar con un medio de transporte más seguro tanto para el como  para sus clientes, ya que les asegura llevar con bien sus pertenencias hasta el lugar destinado. José es muy trabajador por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, esto es muy beneficioso para él ya que cuenta con un trabajo seguro.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and lives in the town of San Juan Opico, department of La Libertad. He lives along with his wife, who dedicates herself to household chores, along with their daughter and granddaughter. José is a very hard-working man who works as a truck driver, transporting all kinds of materials, whether it be wood or sand, and even makes trips for removals. He has two trucks, which are the source of his labor, and thanks to those he counts on daily income. Many times he makes trips from Opico to San Salvador, on which he earns the most. He is requesting the loan with the goal of having the necessary funds to invest in the maintenance of his trucks and make repairs to the truck bed and tie-downs. This will make his trucks more secure as much for him as his customers because it assures he can carry his items safely to their destination. José is a very hard worker who has many customers. This loan is very beneficial for him because it provides job security.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts and make repairs

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sofía Esperanza

texts.es: Sofía Esperanza A. Vda. D. C., es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, quien se dedica a elaborar tortillas en su casa D. habitación, vive en Tonacatepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo D. 66 años D. edad, y junto a sus hijos los cuales son menores D. edad y se dedica a estudiar. A sus 55 años D. edad, Sofía trabaja muy duro elaborando tortillas D. lunes a domingo, sus hijos le ayudan en el negocio, repartiendo las tortillas en las casa D. los diferentes clientes. Sofía es una señora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y D. esta forma brindarle ayuda a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar, lo cual es muy necesario para poder salir adelante. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo D. comprar maíz por mayor para obtenerlo a precios más bajo, D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sofía Esperanza A. Vda. D. C. is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She makes tortillas out of her home in Tonacatepeque, which is located in the Department of San Salvador. Sofía lives with her husband, age 66, and her dependent children who are in school. At 55 years of age, she continues to work very hard making tortillas Monday to Sunday. Her children help with the business by delivering tortillas to the homes of her various customers. Sofía is a woman who is determined to move her family forward and proviD. assistance to her husband in covering all of the household expenses necessary for them to succeed.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. She wants to buy corn in bulk so that she can receive the lowest price. This will allow her to generate better earnings, which will be of great benefit to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn in bulk

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald R. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 27 years old. Ronald is married. To make a living, Ronald raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ronald has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ronald joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ronald has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ronald is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronald from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: 040107_Hai Son _Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hien L. T. (40107046) is a 26 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hai Son Hoang Truong Hoang hoa. Hien is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 040107_Hai Son_Hoang Hoa.


Hien is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Hien operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Hien has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  This will be the 20th loan taken out by Hien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
