He leases a plot of land, where he plants vegetables for sale. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers, in order to get a good harvest. He wants to use the resulting profit to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Kuña Oñepytyvombava Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se conformó mediante el deseo de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.

En la actualidad se encuentran en el séptimo ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y así reciben las capacitaciones con el objetivo de ir mejorando sus actividades mediante el uso  de adecuado de los créditos.

Una de las integrantes es la señora Lidia, quien es ama de casa, muy trabajadora y activa. Ella además de los trabajos de la casa también posee un  negocio donde ofrece diversos productos para usos del hogar y otros artículos generales. En esta ocasión ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como vinos, cervezas, gaseosas, ya que también quiere ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group was formed because the members wanted to work in order to move their families forward. They are currently in their seventh loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. As participants in the program, the members receive training that will help them improve their businesses through the proper use of credit.

One of the members is Sra. Lidia who is a homemaker. She is an active member and a hard worker. In addition to performing the household chores, she also manages a business selling different household products and other types of general merchandise. On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy beverages such as wine, beer, and sodas to sell to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wine, beer, and sodas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase blouses, boxer shorts, ankle braces, towels, and other products

loans.name: Kikanae Ole

texts.en:
Kikanae Ole R. is 24 years old. He is a married to Susan R. and he is a father of one child. He also supports three other members of his family. Kikanae is a farmer. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already registered as a member in KADET. This will be his first loan. He plans to spend fifteen thousand to plough, ten thousand on harrowing, fifteen thousand on seeds, and ten thousand on planting his ten acres with wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by acquiring more land to increase his wheat production.
.
Kikanae's dream is do large-scale farming and buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking young man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To buy wheat seeds, and to harrow and plough his farm

loans.name: Patrick Nganga

texts.en:
Patrick Nganga G. is 32 years old. He is married to Agnes and he is the father of four school-going children. Patrick is a cash crop farmer who has been farming for the last ten years. This is his main source of income.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend twenty thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizers for the cabbages he has already planted, and forty thousand to prepare land to plant more vegetables. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant different varieties of vegetables, like kale and spinach.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale vegetable farmer and also start fruit farming. He is a hardworking man and with the right resources, he can do great.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers for his cabbages and to prepare more land to plant vegetables

loans.name: Oltetia Stephen

texts.en:
Oltetia Stephen Y. is 32 years old. He married to Peninah Y. and he is a father of one school-going child. Oltetia is a farmer. He has been farming his own piece of land for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to spend it to prepare land for planting potatoes. Potatoes have been doing well in his area due to the good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Oltetia’s dream is do large-scale farming and start daily farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals

loans.use: To prepare land for planting potatoes

loans.name: Naitoe Enole

texts.en:
Naitoe Enole N. is 47 years old. She is married to Nepatao N. and she is a mother of three school-going children. She is a farmer and she has been doing this as a main source of income for the last ten years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staffs in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend fifty thousand to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be doing commercial farming. Naitoe believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To prepare the land and plant wheat

loans.name: Twezimbe Womens Group-Kayunga

texts.en:
38-year-old N. Aisha has been in the fish mongering and supplies business for almost 10 years in Kyabakadda- Kayunga. She has mostly been supplying and selling smoked fish to local vendors in her locality. She is a stickler for hard work and this she says has overwhelmingly contributed to her longevity in an always competitive business genre. It is a business that requires constant attending to, and fortunately for her, it has not affected her marriage in any way. She and her 6 children have basked in the glow of a business that generates her 70,000 shillings on a weekly basis. 

She is a long-term planner, and she says she envisions a bright future of being able to supply her fish to bigger markets in and around Kayunga and the surrounding environs. With this loan, she wants to purchase more fish so that she can widen her market in terms of sales.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Terere Ole

texts.en:
Terere Ole M. is 43 years old. He is a married to Noorayiani M. and the father of three children. Terere is a farmer. He has farmed his own piece of land for the last fifteen years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is already a registered member. This will be his first loan. He he is planning to spend ten thousand on harrowing, twenty thousand on seeds, and ten thousand on planting five acres of wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

Terere dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To harrow his field, buy seeds, and plant wheat

loans.name: Grace Koyiasi

texts.en:
Grace Koyiasi S. is 28 years old. She is married to Kuntai and the mother of three school-going children. Grace is a farmer. She has been farming for the last four years. Her farm is in a productive area. Most of her customers are wholesaler from the city who come to buy the produce and then sell it to the city residents.

She learned about KADET through an awareness program done by KADET staffs in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy a new species of potato called ‘sangi’, which research has proven can do very well in her area and have a larger yield. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for her farm produce.

Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have her own farm machinery. Grace is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy a new species of potato called ‘sangi’

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S.  is in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Victoria is 45 years old and married to a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa is 56 years old. She is married with one child who is 24 years old.  Afuwa is commonly known in the business of selling new clothes, including children's clothing, men's shirts, etc.  Afuwa has been in this business for about 13 years and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm daily.

Afuwa is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. She hopes that it will allow her to expand her business through purchasing modern styles and that these styles will bring more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of clothing for sale

loans.name: Basoka Kwavula Kiribedde Group

texts.en:
"If you believe, you can achieve!"--That’s an adage one famous musician often used to inspire his listeners. With a sense of self esteem, as 40-year-old N. Imeldah has learned, one has every opportunity for success in anything he or she does. Success can be in anybody’s grasp if only we believe, she points out. 

Over the course of the last 15 years, she has been a testament to the fact that with self conviction, determination and resolve, one will succeed. In the cut-throat competitive business of tailoring that she in involved in, one needs those virtues to ensure not only short-term but long-term success. 

At the threshold of the mid 90’s, Imeldah was into poultry. She at length used savings from that business to start her current business, which she has been operating in Kisega-Kayunga. She is still eking profits from her poultry business. In a week, she makes profits to the tune of 90,000 shillings. With this loan, she wants to buy more textile material for making clothes.

She is married with 5 children, 3 of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more textile material for making clothes

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a 46 year-old woman who owns a clothing boutique and beauty shop.  She sells men’s, women’s, and baby clothing, along with bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products at her shop.  Before running her shop, Maimuna worked in a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  Her biggest business challenge is financial constraints due to lack of capital.  She is single and has one daughter who is 20 years old.
 
Maimuna plans to use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling loan to buy additional clothes, bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products for resale to her customers.

In the future, she hopes to make her shop into a wholesale distributor of the kinds of products she sells, and she dreams of one day building her own home.

Maimuna describes herself as hardworking, honest, and tolerant.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes, bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. is 30 years old and married to a nurse. She has two children who both go to school. Mary is currently in the business of selling bags of maize flour and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a store for her goods.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 28 years old. He is married and has one child who is 8 years old. Joseph is commonly known in the business of selling men's jeans and t-shirts.  He has been in this business for about 10 years, and the hours of his business are from 6 am to 7 pm daily.

Joseph is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With the use of this loan, Joseph hopes that he will be able to increase the profits of his business. These profits will allow him to ensure the security of his business, as well as create many other sources of income. In addition, Joseph will continue providing better care for the future of his child.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El Señor Feliciano E. P. tiene 48 años y está casada con la Señora Salome Choque de E. por más de 20 años, tienen 3 hijos dependientes que estudian en primaria. Don Feliciano E. P. y su familia viven en una comunidad llamada Pico Central a 68 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero. 

La actividad principal es la agricultura, ellos producen papa, haba, oca en su terreno en la comunidad de Pico Central, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, y en el cuidado de ganado y de los hijos. Don Feliciano E. P. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico para la siembra de papa, según él va ampliar la producción de papa en 2 hectáreas porque tiene terrenos sin cultivar y así ahorrar dinero para que sus hijos terminen el colegio en  Colomi pues en la zona donde viven solo existe escuela de nivel primaria, todo los niños solo tienen educación primaria por falta de recursos económicos.  Los padres no pueden pagar el gasto de estudio hasta nivel secundaria de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 48 years old and has been married to his wife, Salome, for more than 20 years. They have three children who are in primary school. Feliciano and his family live in the community of Pico Central, 68 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba, so it's difficult to go to the bank for a loan. The family makes a living in agriculture, producing potatoes, broad beans and other items on their plot of land. Feliciano's wife helps out and takes care of the livestock and the children. Feliciano is requesting the loan to purchase organic fertilizer to plant with his his potatoes, which he believes will increase his potato production by two hectares because he has some uncultivated land. This will help him save money for when his children complete their primary education, since there are only primary schools in the area where they live and all the children only have that level of education due to a lack of resources. Parents can't afford higher levels of education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 44-year-old man who sells shoes to his local customers. He has been in this business for ten years and his primary business challenge is local competition. Michael is married and has two sons, aged 10 and 15.
Michael plans to use his 25,000 KES loan to buy additional shoe stock to expand the variety of shoes he sells to his customers. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.
In the future, Michael hopes to open another shoe outlet. In five years, he dreams of being a shoe wholesaler, selling shoes both locally and internationally. Michael describes himself as hardworking, faithful and unbiased.

loans.use: To buy additional shoe stock

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce R. is 49 years old and a widow. She has five children and they do not go to school. Joyce is currently in the business of selling maize flour (measuring it with a cup) and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Bivamuntuuyo Katakala Farmers Group-Mityana

texts.en: K. Samuel is 70 years old and has banked on profits from his farming business in Katakala-Mityana for the last 50 years. Farming, as any Ugandan will tell you, has always been a dependable source of finance for most households. Samuel is a testimony to that. In a week, this hardworking old man makes profits that add up to 50,000 UGX. He is very involved in his business despite his age, and this is what he cites as one of the reasons behind his longevity. With this loan, Samuel wants to pay for the mulching of his gardens and he also wants to buy manure.

loans.use: To mulch his gardens and to buy manure

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El señor German V. P. tiene 47 años y está casado con la Señora Lidia Zurita Montaño por más de 15 años, tienen 1 hijo dependiente que estudia en secundaria. Don Germán V. P. y su familia viven en una comunidad rural Kayarani a 56 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los banco para un préstamo de dinero.

La actividad principal de German es la agricultura producen papa, haba, oca en su terreno en la comunidad de Kayarani, la esposa ayuda en la actividad agrícola, y en el cuidado de su ganado y de la casa. Don Germán V. P. necesita dinero para la compra del lote de terreno que está adquiriendo cerca al pueblo de Colomi. En el lote de terreno construirá una casa con las comodidades necesarias para que su hijo pueda vivir con un poco mas de comodidad, según el padre el hijo continuara estudiando a nivel técnico en mecánica automotriz y luego apoyara económicamente a sus padres estos ya no puedan trabajar.
texts.en:
German V. P. is 47 years old and has been married to Mrs. Lidia Zurita Montaño for more than 15 years. They have 1 dependent child who is in secondary school. Mr. Germán V. P. and his family live in the rural community of Kayarani, 56 km from the city of Cochabamba. Because of this, it is very difficult for them to go to the bank for a money loan. German's main activity is farming potatoes, beans, and oka on his land in the community of Kayarani. His wife helps him with the farming and with taking care of the cattle and the house. Mr. Germán V. P. needs money to buy a lot of land which he is acquiring near the town of Colomi. He will build a house on the lot with all of the necessary conveniences so that his son can live a little more comfortably. According to the father, the son will continue studying automotive mechanics and later he will support his parents financially when they can't work anymore.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a lot of land

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío La Huaca del distrito de Olmos, la zona es una comunidad rural situada dentro del distrito con mayor extensión geográfica de la región, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a vender artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en la vivienda donde reside, el negocio es de mucha utilidad para ella, ya que le provee de ingresos económicos con los cuales mantiene a su familia y para su comunidad ya que gracias a su bodega sus vecinos cuentan con diversos productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano, ya que normalmente tendrían que dirigirse hacia el pueblo de Olmos para adquirirlos.

Manuela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de modo que sus clientes puedan encontrar mayor variedad de productos en su negocio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre se ha esforzado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos en Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 53 years old and is a mother. She lives with her 4 children in the village of La Huaca in the Olmos district. She lives in a rural community located within the district's largest geographic region in the Lambayeque province that is more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 3 years she has been making a living selling basic necessity items and groceries from a store that she set up in her house. The business is very beneficial since it provides her with an income that supports her family. It is beneficial for her community also, since it gives her neighbors easy access to various daily use products, whereas normally, they would have to go to the village of Olmos to buy them. Manuela wants to expand her business by buying more goods so that her customers can have a better selection of products from which to choose. In order to meet this goal she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). She is a hard-working woman and has always struggled to provide for her children. She has had previous loans with this institution and has been punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase daily use products for her store that is in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a lot of land to build a home

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 21 años, ella vive junto a su esposo y su hijo Aldair de 4 años de edad, en una casa que le cedieron sus padres. El trabajo que se dedica es la venta de ropa y la manera como llega vender es mediante pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Para esto posee una serie de prendas en diversos diseños y en modelos que está en boga, siendo estos adquiridos en el mercado mayorista y textil de  Lima, y que luego son ofrecidos a un precio más conveniente a sus compradores. En un futuro le gustaría tener un puesto donde pueda ofrecer la mercadería que tiene, exhibiendo vitrinas y maniquíes para tener mayor salida de sus productos. Sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lograra todas sus metas. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 21 years old and lives with her husband and son Aldair, who is 4, in a house given to them by her parents. Alejandra earns a living by selling clothes according to her customers’ requests. She stocks a variety of clothing styles and designs that are in fashion which are purchased in the wholesale textile markets in Lima and then offered at a more convenient price for her buyers. In the future she would like to have a clothing stand with display cases and mannequins to display her merchandise in order to increase the turnover of her products. She knows that by much dedicated effort she will achieve all her goals. This is her first loan with MFP and she commits to being very punctual with all her payments. With the loan she is seeking she plans to buy a greater quantity of merchandise by which to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing merchandise

loans.name: Balyesima Womens Group-Mpigi

texts.en: N. Prossy is a 37-year-old married mother of five who runs a general merchandise retail shop in Lugale-Mpigi. A rags to relative riches story is what she calls her journey through the tough terrain of business. She set forth 12 years ago operating a chapatti and pan cake sales business. She describes herself as persona grata, saying her good relationship skills have played in her favor as she runs her business. In a week, her business generates profits that total 70,000 UGX. With this loan, she wants to buy more bags of sugar, salt, bars of soap, bags of maize flour and plastics that she says she will resell to earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy more retail items such as sugar, salt, soap etc.

loans.name: Pablo Issac

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Isaac H. A. tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la zona de Tabladita Barrio Senac de la ciudad de Tarija. Pablo es casado con la señora Litzi Lisbeth Michel Villagomez de 23 años de edad con quien tiene una hija de 2 años. 

Pablo se dedica al servicio de mecánica de motos trabajo que viene realizando desde hace muchísimos años. Pablo nos dice que su taller está creciendo y tiene la necesidad de comprar más herramientas. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para de ese modo poder comprar más herramientas de trabajo y de esa manera poder incrementar sus ingresos.  

Pablo nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darle comodidad y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para la compra de un lote de terreno donde pueda hacer construir una casa para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Isaac H. A., 25, lives in the Tabladita Barrio Senac section of the city of Tarija. Pablo is married to Litzi Lisbeth Michel Villagomez, 23, with whom he has a two-year-old daughter. Pablo earns a living as a motorcycle mechanic, a type of work he has done for many many years. Pablo tells us his workshop is growing and he must buy more tools. He is soliciting a loan in order to buy more work tools and thus be able to raise his income. Pablo tells us his greatest wish is to be able to provide for his family’s needs and comfort. He also mentions that the next loan he requests will be for the purchase of a plot of land where he may build a house for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Solidaridad esta integrado por dos socios, Manuela de los Santos R. R. y Arecely del Carmen M. R..  Residen en Colonia Solidaridad en Juticalpa, Olancho, Honduras.  

Manuela de los Santos R. R. tiene 71 anos de edad, esta casada y tiene 9 hijos.  Se dedica a la elaboracion de coronas de flores desde 28 anos y aprendio con su madre.  Trabaja con sus hijos desde las 6 de la manana hasta las 7 de la noche aunque ella no tiene horario de salida.  No tiene mucha competencia pero cuando llueve tiene muchas dificultades. 

Invertira el prestamo en materias como papel y alambre para elaboración de las coronas.  Los prestamos le ha ayudado ya que hizo su vivienda y le sigue ayudando para mantener su negocio.  

Vive afuera de la cuidad y paga mucho transporte y padece de alta presion.  Su meta es mejorar su casa y tener siempre su negocio.       

Arecely del Carmen M. R. vende frutas y verduras en el Parque Central de Juticalpa.  Con el prestamo comprara frutas y verduras para vender y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Grupo Solidario Solidaridad is formed by two members: Manuela de los Santos R. R. and Arecely del Carmen M. R.. They live in Colonia Solidaridad in Juticalpa, Olancho in Honduras.

Manuela de los Santos R. R. is 71 years old, married, and has 9 children. She has worked making flower wreaths since she was 28 years old and learned from her mother. She works with her children from 6 o’clock in the morning until 7 o’clock at night, although she doesn’t have an ending schedule. She doesn’t have much competition but when it rains it is problematic.

She will invest the loan in materials such as paper and wire to make the wreaths. The loans have helped her as she made her home and they continue helping her to maintain her business.

She lives outside of the city and pays for a lot of transport and suffers from high blood pressure. Her goal is to improve her home and to always have her business.

Arecely del Carmen M. R. sells fruits and vegetables in the central park of Juticalpa. With the loan, she will purchase fruits and vegetables to sell and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material such as paper and wire for making wreaths

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo dentro del tercer ciclo y todas se encuentran muy satisfechas con su trabajo, pero desean seguir trabajando para lograr mayores cosas, y sacar adelante a sus familias de la mejor manera.
Así cada una trabaja realiza actividades diferentes para sus ingresos individuales y también realizan trabajos en conjunto para  y de esa manera contar con un fondo en común para cualquier emergencia. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Estela quien se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos.
Su actividad consiste en vender sus productos sobre pedido es decir sus clientes solicitan los productos y de acuerdo a la cantidad solicitada, y los vende, en la mayoría de los caso a créditos. 
Actualmente cuenta con varios pedidos y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como cremas para la piel, perfumes, maquillejes.
texts.en:
This group is in the middle of the development of their third loan cycle and everyone is very satisfied with their work. However, they want to continue working to achieve bigger things and have their families succeed in the best way.

Each member has different activities for their individual earnings and they also have jobs that they do together so that they have a communal fund for any emergency.

One of the group members is Maria Estela who works in cosmetics sales. Her business consists of selling her products by order, which means that her clients request products and according to the amount requested, she sells them in the majority of cases on credit. She currently has several requests and as a result, she is requesting the loan for the purchase of cosmetics such as skin creams, perfumes, and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of skin creams, perfumes, makeup, and other accessories

loans.name: Santos Teresa

texts.es:
Santos tiene 24 años de edad, reside en El municipio de San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 7 años de edad, el negocio que posee es venta de pescado seco. 
Hace cinco años se dedica al comercio de pescado seco y tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de San Francisco Gotera, con los ingresos de las ventas solventa los gastos de primera necesidad y estudios de su pequeña hija.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra de pescado seco, camarones, chacalines y otros productos marinos que son solicitado por los clientes, esto contribuirá a Santos a mejora el negocio, generar ingresos para que apoye a la familia.
las aspiraciones son algún día tener casa propia ,apoyar su pequeña hija termine los estudio, mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 24 years old and lives in the town of San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother with a 7-year-old daughter. She has a business selling dried fish. Santos has made a living selling dried fish for five years and has a stand in the San Francisco Gotera town market. Her income from her sales allows her to pay for her everyday needs as well as her young daughter’s studies. Santos is now asking for a loan so that she can purchase dried fish, shrimp, and other seafood that her customers are requesting. This loan will allow Santos to improve her business and to generate income in order to help her family. Her dreams are to someday have her own house, to help her daughter finish her studies, and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing dried fish, shrimp, and other seafood.

loans.name: María Jovita

texts.es:
María Jovita tiene 50 años D. edad, es separada, no cuenta con carga familiar y resiD. en el distrito D. La Victoria, un distrito que durante los ultimos meses ha experimentado un considerable crecimiento urbano, es un distrito que limita con la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María se dedida al comercio mayorista D. verduras en el mercado Los Pathos, un mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, allí, ella va desD. muy tempranas horas a adquirir verduras D. temporada a los distribuidores que traen sus productos en camiones para luego ofrecérselas durante la mañana a los comerciantes minoristas D. la región. Ella tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, lo que le ha permitido hacerse conocida en el rubro.

María desea realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura D. su vivienda D. modo que pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.	

Ella es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Jovita is 50 years old, separated and lives by herself in La Victoria, a district that has experienced considerable urban growth over the past months. The district borders the city of Chiclayo, Peru. María makes a living as a wholesale merchant selling vegetables in the Los Pathos market, a wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. She goes there very early in the morning to acquire her seasonal vegetables from the distributors who bring the products in trucks, and then offers the products throughout the morning to the retail merchants of the region. She has a good amount of experience in the business, which has allowed her to become known in the traD.. María wishes to carry out some improvements to her home's infrastructure to improve her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to achieve this objective. She is a hard-working and responsible person who has taken out loans in the past and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her home's infrastructure

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Victor Hugo C. R. tiene 45 años de edad y vive en el barrio San Jose de la ciudad de Tarija. Victor es divorciado desde hace 7 años y vive en una casa en anticrético.

Victor se dedica desde hace mas de 15 años a la actividad de la sastrería teniendo vaR. clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Victor nos dice  que tiene un contrato de trabajo y necesita material para realizar su trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito que solicita es para la compra de forro, entretela, botones, cierres, hilos, etc.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
Victor nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad a sus hijos para que no les falte nada y puedan ser profesionales en un futuro cercano. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite quisiera utilizarlo en la compra de más maquinaria para su sastrería.
texts.en:
Victor Hugo C. R., 45, lives in the San Jose neighborhood of the city of Tarija. Victor has been divorced for seven years and lives rent-free in a house for which he paid a deposit with a short-term contract. Victor has earned a living for more than fifteen years as a tailor with a number of customers who seek his services. Victor tells us he has a contract for some work and needs materials to complete it. Thus he is seeking a loan in order to purchase materials to make linings and interlinings, buttons, zippers, thread, etc. Victor tells us his greatest desire is to provide for the comfort of his children so that they may not lack anything and that they may become professionals in the near future. He also tells us that he would like to use the next loan he seeks to purchase additional machinery for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for a tailor shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 20 años, se dedica a remendar  y entallar chaquetas en su máquina de coser, siendo su única herramienta de trabajo, que la ha ayudado para satisfacer sus necesidades. Con el tiempo ha llegado a convertirse en una especialista en zurcidos para prendas deterioradas, ante esto sus clientes le tiene estimada y consideración por el buen trabajo que realiza. Ahora que incursiona en el mundo de la confección, aun le falta por aprender mucho, pero se siente satisfecha por la productividad de su negocio. Sin embargo durante los días que no tiene material en que trabajar, se dedica al reciclado junto a su esposo, de esa manera consiguen ingresos adicionales para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su mercado y renovar su maquina por otra multifuncional. Es su quinceavo crédito con  MFP, y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta hoy, puesto que este aporte le será muy favorable para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará telas polares, debido a la estación de invierno en la que tienen que soportar, así que la demanda de prendas de vestir a base de este material ha aumentado y espera confeccionar lo suficiente para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, lives in her own home with her husband and three children. For more than 20 years she has earned an income making alterations and repairs to jackets on her sewing machine, which is her only work tool. Over time she has come to specialize in sewing up rips and tears in clothes that are somewhat worn for which her customers recognize and appreciate the good work she does. Now she is experimenting in the world of dressmaking. She still has a lot to learn, but she feels satisfied at the productivity of her business. However on days when she does not have material with which to work she and her husband dedicate themselves to recycling activities and so are able to bring in additional income for the needs of their children. Her greatest wishes are to expand her market and to update her sewing machine with a multifunctional one. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she commits to making all her payments, as she has done, given that this support will be very helpful to her in increasing her working capital. With this loan she will buy polar fleece fabric. Because of the winter season which must be endured demand for clothing made from this material has gone up. She hopes to construct enough of this type of clothing to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase polar fleece for making winter clothing

loans.name: Rosa Esmerencia

texts.es:
Rosa de 42 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda pequeña en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Rosa tenia una tienda pequeña donde antes vivía Coop. Paraíso pero como sus ingresos no eran tan buenos decidió ir a vivir a otro lugar y comprar un terreno para construir su casa. Poco a poco comenzó a vender papelería, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días.   

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una vitrina, papelería, portarretratos, etc. En el futuro quiere arreglar su negocio, y su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives in on the outskirts of Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone surrounded by the Guayaquil swamp). She has a small shop at the front of her house. Rosa used to have a small shop where she used to live in Coop. Paraíso but as her earnings weren't very good she decided to live in another location and purchase a plot of land to build her house. Little by little Rosa began selling stationery, and from this time until now she has worked from 6am until 10pm every day. To stock her shop more Rosa wants to buy a glass display cabinet, stationery, photo frames etc. In the future she wants to repair her shop and house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display cabinet and stationery

loans.name: Alinyikira Kazinga Development Group - Mukono

texts.en:
Teo B.'s business start-up story dates back to 20 years ago in Kazinga-Mukono. She picked the brain of husband, wanting to learn from him how to emulate his success. After the demise of her husband, she began a charcoal sales business. It was not long, however, until she dropped it and began a business that she still has the reins over - her general merchandise retail shop. 

With weekly profits totaling 200,000 shillings, 45-year-old Teo B. is now fully in her stride. She is looking to strengthen her profits and revenue base through the purchase of more retail items with this loan.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items for resale

loans.name: Senia Patricia

texts.es:
Senia tiene 38 años D. edad, ResiD. en la Ciudad D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijas D. 15 y 14 años D. edad, tiene un negocio D. venta D. lácteos.
El negocio lo inicio hace 14 años por iniciativa propia, tiene una empleada y la hijas le colaboran atendiendo el negocio, su horario es D. 6:00am-6:00pm es una persona con experiencia en el negocio, ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. productos, queso, crema, cuajada, quesillo, esto contribuirá a cumplir con las expectativas D. los clientes. 
Las aspiraciones son tener un local propio y amplio, mejora las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Senia is 38 years of age, is married, and lives in Usulután city. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters (15 and 14) and has a dairy sale business. Senia began her business 14 years ago on her own initiative. She has one employee and her daughters help her in the shop, which is open from 6am to pm. Senia is experienced at this business and is seeking a loan to purchase products such as cheese, cream, curd, sot cheese to assist in meeting her customers' expectations. Her aspirations are to have her own expanded premises and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, cream, curd and soft cheese

loans.name: Sharon Andrea

texts.es: Sharon Andrea B. B., tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltera, y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 6 y otro de 1 año de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para realizar las costuras. Ella cuenta con una máquina de coser, pero desea aumentar el inventario de materiales para ofrecer a sus clientes. Tiene varios años de  dedicarse a la costura, y  cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer variedad de telas, y de tener los materiales necesarios para realizar sus costuras y así poder ofrecer calidad en sus productos, además de aportar mayores ingresos a la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le brindaron siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como profesional.
texts.en:
Sharon Andrea B. B. is 27 years old and single. She has two children, aged 6 and 1. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make clothing. She has a sewing machine, but she would like to broaden the range of materials she offers to her customers. She has worked as a tailor for several years, and she has very good customers. For this reason, she feels the need to offer a wider variety of fabrics and stock the necessary supplies to make a range of clothing, so she can offer high-quality products and also contribute more income to her household economy. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very grateful for the terms that they always offer. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Ruth Wandy

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth, es una persona joven y muy trabajadora, su actividad es la elaboracion de pan y de empanadas se levanta desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana para la elaboracion de sus productos que lo realiza con la ayuda de su Mama, quien lo comercializa en las tiendas y tambien realiza a pedidos, aprendio este oficio de su Mama, el dinero del credito lo invertira en la compra de harina al por mayor, levadura, y otros insumos para la elaboracion de sus productos, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza que le brindaron y le ayudaran a cumplir a largo plazo uno e sus sueños que es el de abrir su propia cafeteria y asi poder ofrecer una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Ruth is a young and very hard-working woman. She makes bread and empanadas, getting up in the very early hours of the morning to make her products, which she does with the help of her mother who sells them to shops and also prepares the orders. Ruth learned this trade from her mother. The money she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of large quantities of flour, yeast, and other ingredients to make her products. Ruth is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown and the help they have given her to achieve one of her long-term dreams, which is to open her own cafe and offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Agip Womens Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Fifteen years is the time frame that 32-year-old Harriet N. has spent running her salon business in Seeta-Mukono. She was at first into a clothes-selling business. With determination in tow, she fought against all odds to earn her stripes in a business which was increasingly becoming more competitive by the day. 

With the passage of time, she drew up other blueprint plans to obtain a footing in her current business. Profits from this business and her other subsidiary rental business have empowered her in the provision of care and financial support to her family of six. 

At 32, she is happily married and she says her future prospects are good on the basis of the support her spouse gives her. In a week, she makes profits that add to 170,000 shillings. With this loan, she says she wants to purchase another dryer.

loans.use: The purchase of a dryer

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Jorgelina Agüero, quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar otro comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “María Auxiliadora” se encuentra trabajando dentro del quinto ciclo, y todas están muy contentas con el programas Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Marcelina quien se a dedica la confección de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños.
Actualmente la señora Marcelina quiere hacer unas mejoras en su vivienda como en colocación de puertas y ventanas, y para concretar este proyecto ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de  los materiales y el pago por mano de obra.
texts.en:
Señora Jorgelina Agüero initiated the formation of this committee, contacting her neighbours and friends to form another committee in the zone. The committee is called "María Auxiliadora" and is in its fifth loan cycle. All the members are very happy with the programs in Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras and the group is known in the neighbourhood for being very united, supportive and responsible. One of the members is Marcelinam, who works making clothing for women, gentlemen and children. Marcelina wants to make some improvements to her home, including installing doors and windows, and to finish this project she is seeking a loan to purchase materials and pay for labour.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase doors and windows

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La  señora Maribel S. E. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en el barrio Defensores del Chaco de la ciudad de Tarija. Maribel  es casada pero su esposo por motivos de trabajo se fue a la argentina, con quien tiene dos hijos. 
Maribel se dedica desde hace mas de 2 años a la elaboración de salteñas (empanadas al horno con relleno de carne o pollo) teniendo varios clientes que consumen sus alimentos.                                                                                                                                                             Maribel nos dice  que tiene la necesidad de comprarse otro horno industrial para incrementar el número de salteñas que elabora para que mejoren sus ingresos familiares. Es por eso que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito para la compra de dicho horno.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                  Maribel nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad a sus hijos para que no les falte nada y puedan ser felices y en un futuro cercano verlos estudiar y llegar a ser profesionales. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite quisiera utilizarlo para poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel S. E. is 20 years old and lives in the Defensores del Chaco suburb in Tarija city. Maribel is married and has two children with her husband, who for work reasons has gone to Argentina. For over 2 years Maribel has worked making salteñas (oven-baked empanadas with meat or chicken filling), having many clients who consume her food. Maribel tells us that she needs to purchase another industrial oven to increase the number of salteñas that she makes to increase her family's earnings. For this reason she is seeking a loan to purchase this oven. Maribel's biggest dream is to give her children every comfort so they don't want for anything and so that they can be happy, and in the near future see them study and become professionals. She also says that the next loan that she seeks will be used to improve her home's conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: cette femme est une veuve et est âgée de 41 ans, elle a 3 personnes à sa charge. elle parvient à satisfaire à leurs besoins grâce à l'activité qu'elle exerce qui est la coiffure. elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans.Pour diversifier son activité et accroître ses recettes elle veut associé à son activité la vente de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle sollicite chez WAGES un prêt pour acheter 5 bidons d'huile, 6 sacs de riz, 1é cartons de tomates  et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This woman is a 41-year old widow with three people in her care. She manages to provide for their needs by working as a hairdresser. She has been doing this for over five years. In order to diversify her activities and supplement her income, she wants to start selling general grocery items. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy five cans of oil, six bags of rice, one box of tomatoes and various other products.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general grocery items

loans.name: Domingo Santos

texts.es:
El señor Domingo Santos G. S. tiene 22 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de El Huaico  provincia Aviles de la ciudad de Tarija. Domingo aun no se caso y vive en la casa de sus padres.   
       
Domingo se dedica a la producción de papa y maíz misma que vende en el mercado de Tarija. También se dedica a trabajar como albañil ambas actividades las viene realizando desde hace muchísimos años. Pero el nos cuenta que tienen la necesidad de comprar semillas de papa y comprar herramientas de trabajo. Es por eso que solicita el crédito, para de este modo poder incrementar su producción y sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                              Domingo nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres y hermanos para que sean felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa. Domingo quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos.
texts.en:
Señor Domingo Santos G. S. is 22 years old and lives in the El Huaico community in the Aviles province in the city of Tarija. Domingo is not yet married and lives with his parents. Domingo grows potatoes and corn that he sells in the Tarija market. He also works as a mason. He has worked both jobs for many years. He tells us that he needs to buy potato seeds and work tools. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan. This will help him to increase his production and his income. Domingo tells us that his biggest dream is to be able to give his parents and siblings all the comforts that he can so that they are happy. Also, he says that the next loan that he requests will be to make improvements to his home. Domingo would like to have a family one day with children and eventually, grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and work tools

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 24 años de edad, reside en San Fransico Gotera, departamento de Morazan, es soltera vive los padres, y tiene un negocio de procesamiento de productos lacteos.
Hace tres años se deica al procesamiento y venta de productos lacteos, el cual se lo enseño la madre y le colabora en el procesamiento, ella compra la leche a otras personas, elabora y comercializa el queso y crema en la casa de avitacion, sus cleintes son en mayoria los vecinos, Milagro se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un prestamo para compra de leche por mayor y que le den un precio bajo permitiendole continuar con el necocio, obtener mayores ingresos.
los sueños ser una proveedora al mayoreo de productos lacteos, y poder dale una mejor calidad de vida a la familia.
texts.en:
Milagro is 24 years old and lives in San Fransico Gotera, in the Morazan department. She is single, lives with her parents, and runs a business processing milk products. She’s been processing and selling milk products for the past three years. Her mother taught her how to do this and helps her with the processing. She buys her milk from other people and uses it to make cheese and cream in her home. Her neighbors are her primary customers. Milagro has seen the need to request this loan so that she can buy milk in bulk, which she can do at better prices, and which will allow her to continue with her business and obtain greater earnings. Her dream is to become a large provider of milk products and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk in bulk

loans.name: Embajadores Group

texts.en: Juan plans to use this loan to invest in his business: a fruit stand where he sells all kinds of fruit. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and two children. He has had his business for two years, starting when he stopped working in private enterprise. He says that his most difficult challenge is to bring home income even when he doesn't have a job. In the meantime he plans to continue to enjoy his work and being with his family. He will use his profits to invest in his business and house. His future plan is to have a fruit mall. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. His group is located in rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable). Juan is the coordinator of his group Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors"). He is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. This associate began with Esperanza because it is an interesting program offering more than just loans and low interest.

loans.use: To buy fruits like bananas, pineapples, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven  de 25 años de edad,  padre de dos hijos, desde joven se caso, aun no teniendo donde vivir, se quedo en la casa de su suegra. Comienza a trabajar vendiendo leche agria oficio que sus padres hacían.
Actualmente tiene un trabajo fijo, en seguridad de veinte cuatro horas, y con su tiempo libre junto con su esposa venden la leche agria.
Con este financiamiento quiere mejorar su pequeño cuarto que tiene hecho de zinc y madera, ya muy vieja.
Lo que necesita hacer las mejoras ya que tiene que velar por la seguridad de su familia. Lo que comprara: ocho láminas de zinc, siete cuartones de madera, piedra, cemento,  para poder reparar su pequeño cuarto.
Lo que espera ir mejorando cada vez con los financiamientos ya que no cuenta con dinero en efectivo por los gastos que tiene que cubrir.
Lo que se favorece con los prestamos a plazo  por su forma de pago.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 25 year old young man and the father of two children. He married at a young age. Since he didn't have a place to live he moved in with his mother-in-law. He started out by working at his parents profession, selling fermented milk (similar to yogurt). Currently, he has a steady job in 24 hour security. In his free time he sells fermented milk with his wife. With this loan he wants to make improvements to their small room because it has a very old zinc and wood roof. This is to ensure the safety of his family. He will buy eight sheets of zinc, seven wood beams, stone and cement to repair their small room. He hopes to continue making improvements with loans since he doesn't have the money for the expenses that he has to cover. He favors term loans because of the repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase eight sheets of zinc, seven wood beams, stone, sand and cement to start the improvements on his room

loans.name: Monasterios Callizaya

texts.es: El joven J. C. se dedica a la venta de balones desde hace dos años,  tiene clientes fijos que le hacen pedidos de Provincias de la ciudad de Cochabamba  y también en la ciudad, le va muy bien con la venta de sus productos que son balones futbol, también balones para piscinas,  este crédito es para la compra de variedad de tamaños de balones, el trabaja ya con un banco de emprendimiento  Villa Paraíso, esta en su tercer ciclo, también saca créditos oportunos, donde ha demostrado ser muy cumplido es sus pagos. El Joven  vive en alquiler, en la casa de su tía, es soltero, con muchas ganas de superación, también tiene deseos de terminar sus estudios y ser profesional para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
J. C. has been selling balls for the past two years. He has steady customers who send him orders from the Cochabamba provinces and also from within the city itself. Sales of his products are doing well. They include soccer balls, and balls for swimming pools. He will use the money from this loan to buy balls of different sizes. He works with an entrepreneurial bank (communal bank) called “Villa Paraíso” (Paradise Way). It’s in its third cycle and he has also obtained loans of opportunity, for which he has established a good repayment record. This young man lives in his aunt’s house, for which he pays rent. He is single and has lots of ambition to succeed. He also wants to complete his studies and establish a professional career in order to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell spare auto parts

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar de 48 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), el da servicio de transporte puerta a puerta. 

Antes el trabajaba en una empresa pero como su contrato expiro lo liquidaron y tuvo que buscar otro. Al buscar y no encontrar tuvo que comenzar a trabajar como chofer, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ese ha sido su trabajo para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijas. Trabaja desde las 06:30am hasta las 19:00pm todos los días. 

El quiere que su familia viva mejor por eso con el préstamo quiere readecuar su casa comprando cemento y bloques, en el futuro quiere tener un jardín de infantes en el patio de su casa.
texts.en:
Cesar is 48 years old and lives in the suburban zone of Guayaquil. He is in the door-to-door transportation business. He used to work for another company, but his contract expired and he was let go and had to find another job. He was not able to find other work, so he began working as a driver. Since then, this has been his livelihood with which he supports his wife and two daughters. He works from 6:30 AM to 7:00 PM every day and wants his family to have the best, so he is requesting this loan so that he can buy cement and cinder blocks so that he can refurbish his home. In the future he would like to have a playground in his patio area.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Koffi Jean

texts.fr: A. koffi jean est âgé de 42 ans, il a ouvert sa propre boutique  de vente de matériaux de construction, il a appelé cette boutique "Ets merlin electrique". sa clientèle est composée en majorité d'entrepreneurs. il fait ce commerce depuis  plus de 10 déjà, il doit approvisionner une maison en construction c'est pour cette raison qu'il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 10 rouleaux de fil TH 25, 10 rouleaux de fils TH 15, 4 rouleaux de fil 4M et divers autres materiaux. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi Jean A. is 42-years old. He opened a shop called “Ets Merlin Electrique” where he sells construction materials. His clientele consists primarily of contractors, and he has been running this business for over ten years already. In order to supply a house under construction, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 10 rolls of TH 25 wire, 10 rolls of TH 15 wire, 4 rolls of 4M wire and various other materials. He is married with two children.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
La   Sra. María Elva  es soltera  tiene   cinco  hijos,  dos  en edad escolar y tres mayores de edad que viven todavía con ella.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, en forma ambulante, la misma le genera un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas, como remeras, buzos, pantalones, camperas.
texts.en:
Ms. María Elva is single and has five children, two of whom are of school age and three are adults who still live with her. She sells clothing on foot and this brings her a good income. With the help of her children, and with great sacrifice and dedication, they are all getting ahead. Today her small company is very successful and has many customers because of her good customer service. She has demonstrated herself to be a very honest and responsible person. She is asking for his loan in order to buy clothing, such as t-shirt, pants, sweaters, and jackets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El Señor Rolando es la primera vez que trabaja con emprender,  llego a la institución por recomendación de sus Padres,  es joven y sus padres indican que es muy responsable en su trabajo, se dedica a la confección de balones desde hace ocho años,  tiene clientes fijos que les compran en  las Ciudades de Santa Cruz  y Cochabamba,  este crédito es para la compra de cuero, lona y otros materiales para la confeccion de sus productos. El señor vive en casa de su padres, es soltero y ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar, ya que el es único que trabaja, sus padres están muy orgullosos del Sr. Rolando ya que le va muy bien en su trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the first time that Mr. Rolando has worked with Emprender and he came to us following his parents’ recommendation. He is young and his parents tell us that he is very responsible with his work. He’s been making and selling balls for the past eight years. He has regular customers from the cities of Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. He will use the money from this loan to buy leather, canvas, and other materials for manufacturing his products. [Rolando] lives in his parents’ home, he is single, and helps with the household expenses, as he is the only one in the household who works. His parents are very proud of Mr. Rolando, because his business is doing well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a shop and purchase the necessary merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años, es una madre trabajadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos. El limpiar C. y lavar ropa ajena, han sido en la vida de María una actividad necesaria para vivir. Desde su juventud y cuando la abandonó  su esposo,  dicha labor la ayudó a mantener  a sus hijos. Con el pasar de los años fue desempeñándose en la bisutería, bordados y tejidos a  crochet y agujas. Ahora tiene dos actividades, durante la semana, solo dos a tres días se dedica en la limpieza de casa y los demás días elabora chompas y otras prendas, en el que son exportados al extranjero. Lleva 15 años trabajando en esta actividad  y considera que le gusta su trabajo, porque no descuida a sus hijos, además le da la rentabilidad que necesita. Su mayor anhelo es educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, ya que sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que solicita, piensa  comprar conos de hilos al por mayor, en diversos colores y grosor, siendo una herramienta necesaria para tejer chompas.
texts.en:
María, age 35, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her four children. Cleaning houses and washing other people’s clothes have been necessary activities in Maria’s life in order to live. Since her youth and when her husband abandoned her, this work helped her support her children. As the years passed, she was working with jewelry, embroidery, and knitting and crocheting items. She now has two activities. During the week, only two or three days, she cleans houses. The other days she makes sweaters and other garments. They are exported to foreign countries. She has been working in this activity for 15 years. The thing she likes best about her work is that she is not neglecting her children. Also, it gives her the profits that she needs. Her greatest desire is to educate her children and expand her business. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She pledges to make her payments on time. She knows that this support will be very useful to the progress of her business. She plans to use the requested loan to buy yarn wholesale. She will buy different colors and thicknesses of yarn. Yarn is a necessary tool to knit sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yarn to knit sweaters

loans.name: Kiburara Tweheyo, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Stephen B. has subsisted on profits from his eight-year-old produce-selling business in the Kiburara market of Ibanda and those profits cater to all his family responsibilities. He is a married man with three children. What has through the years played havoc with his business are the constant unpredictable weather changes. In his business, he has mostly been relying on his down-to-earth demeanor to attract customers. 

In a week, his business brings him profits that amount to 40,000 shillings. With this loan, he wants to buy more lucrative cash crops like coffee, maize and cassava that he will later resell.

loans.use: Purchasing more cash crops like coffee and cassava for resale

loans.name: Yao Seth

texts.fr: A. yao, est un pasteur, il est marié et a 3 enfants. pour gagner plus de revenu il s'est lancé dans la production de CD audio et video pour enregistrer ses propres chansons audio et vidéo pour vendre. il a besoin de CD audio et video suffisant pour vendre ses nouvelles chansons. raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5000 unités de CD audio et 2500 unités de CD vidéos au GHANA.
texts.en:
A. Yao is a preacher. He is married and has three children. In order to increase his income, he has launched a production of audio and video CDs with his own songs, for resale. He needs a sufficient quantity of audio and video CDs in order to sell his new songs. This is why he is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 5,000 units of audio CDs and 2500 units of video CDs in Ghana.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing blank video and audio CDs

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Julia plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying secondhand clothing bags and selling them by the piece. She has had her business for around three years. She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to provide her family support and unity after getting divorced. At present, she enjoys being with her children and cook.

Julia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Esperanza 1 & 2 ("Women of Hope"). She is excited to be taking out her first loan. She will use her profits to buy things they need as a family and she dreams of having a beauty salon and a good house.

This associate began with Esperanza because she likes the program: it is the first time loans like those offered by Esperanza have reached her community, and her friends are also involved in her loan group, which helps people with their business initiatives. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sufficiently stock her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.es: Ysidora,  D. 53 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive  en su casa propia junto a su esposo y 3 hijos. Hace más D. 10 años venD. gaseosas, cervezas, así como productos comestibles, D. esa manera ha logrado tener su bodega, situado en un pequeño espacio dentro D. su casa, siendo uno D. los negocios más concurridos D. su barrio. El trato que ofrece a sus clientes es muy calido y además esta muy atenta a las necesidades del cliente, lo cual la ha convertido en la preferida D. ellos. Disfruta mucho D. su trabajo, le da las rentas que necesita, por tal procura abastecerlo D. productos variados. Ahora cuenta con estantes y vitrinas eso la ayuda a la exhibición D. sus productos. Su gran anhelo es incrementar D. mercadería y ampliar su mercado. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente ya que sabe que le será muy fructífero para su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería y D. ese modo surtirlos con productos variados.
texts.en:
Ysidora, age 53, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. For over ten years she has been selling soft drinks, beer, and food products. This is the way she came to have her grocery store, which is located in a small space in her house. Her store is one of the most popular businesses in the neighborhood. She treats her customers very warmly, and she is very attentive to her customers’ needs. This has turned her business into the most preferred. She enjoys her work a lot, and it gives her the profits that she needs. She tries to stock it with varied products. She now has shelves and display cases, which help her show her products. Her great desire is to increase her merchandise and expand her market. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She pledges to make all of her payments punctually. She knows that it will be productive for her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy merchandise to stock her business with varied products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products to stock her store

loans.name: Ablavi Sena Emefa

texts.fr: D. est une femme veuve, elle a 2 enfants à sa charge.elle dispose de son propre atelier de couture. elle confectionne aussi des habits avec des pagnes et des tissus pour les revendre à sa clientèle. le stock de matériel nécessaire à son activité de couture est épuisé c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES pour la deuxième fois un crédit pour l'achat de 8 m de tissus, 106 gripures, 5 boîtes de boutons, 190 fil à coudre et divers.
texts.en:
D. est une femme veuve, elle a 2 enfants à sa charge.elle dispose de son propre atelier de couture. elle confectionne aussi des habits avec des pagnes et des tissus pour les revendre à sa clientèle. le stock de matériel nécessaire à son activité de couture est épuisé c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES pour la deuxième fois un crédit pour l'achat de 8 m de tissus, 106 gripures, 5 boîtes de boutons, 190 fil à coudre et divers. Ms. D. is widowed with two dependent children. She is a seamstress and makes clothing from traditional cloth and other material for her customers. She has run out of material needed for her sewing business, and so for the second time she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy eight meters of material, 106 pieces of gimp [coarse lace], five boxes of buttons, 190 spools of sewing thread, and other items.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth, gimp, buttons and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Display case, perfumes, paper goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa A.  est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, son époux et un agronome, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, son lieu d'approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé où ce commerce est très développé. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 3 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un autre crédit pour l'achat de 10 pièces de pagnes hi target, 9 pièces de pagnes phoénix, 7 pièces de pagnes GTP, 3 pièces de pagnes holandaise.
texts.en:
Afiwa A. is married and the mother of 2 children. Her spouse is an agronomist. To generate income, she sells pagne (printed cotton) fabric. She has been in this business since 2000. She gets her supplies from Lomé’s general market where this commerce thrives. She has already received 3 loans from WAGES that she has repaid in full. She is requesting another loan from WAGES to purchase 10 units of “hi target” pagne cloth, 9 units of “phoénix” pagne cloth, 7 units of “GTP” pagne cloth and 3 units of “holandaise” pagne cloth.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase loincloths

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Señor se dedica a la confección de balones desde hace quince años,  tiene clientes fijos que les compran en el cercado de Cochabamba,  este es su primer préstamo con emprender, su  crédito es para la compra de cuero, tela y otros materiales para elaborar los balones, lleva ya muchos años en la elaboración de los mismos.  El señor tiene casa propia recibe la ayuda de su esposa quien le ayuda en la comercialización de los balones,  tiene tres hijos que se encuentran en la Universidad, es muy responsable con su negocio y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
This gentleman manufactures and sells balls and has been doing so for the past fifteen years. He has steady customers near the city of Cochabamba who buy from him. This will be his first loan through Emprender. He will use the money to buy leather, cloth, and other materials to manufacture his balls. He’s been doing this for many years. He has his own home and his wife helps him with sales of his product. They have three children who attend university. He is very responsible with his business and he is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they have placed in him by helping him get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for help with plowing and weeding, and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Bufunda United Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
Operating an agricultural farm has been an adventurous and challenging business venture for one Sam T., a 36-year-old from Ibanda. Being a determined, energetic and hardworking young man, he worked tooth and nail to start selling bananas, which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda, alongside his teaching profession.

He is so fond of his enterprise; thus, he is always able to earn 300,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This loan is to help him do the mulching and buy stake poles and pesticides for his plantation. Expansion of the project to a larger scale is his main motive for this loan. This will help to improve on Sam's yields and production and lead to an increase in sales revenue which will enable him enjoy a self-sustainable livelihood. Sam has on a black jacket  in the photo.

loans.use: To help with mulching, buying stake poles and pesticides for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fertiliser

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: G. ama est une femme très dynamique,  elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille à adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes, chaussures et sacs de femme.elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, pour avoir plus de client il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite un 3ème crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de sacs, 10 cartons de chaussures.
texts.en:
Ama G. is a very dynamic lady. She is married and mother to two children, and she lives with her family in Adidogomé, which is one of the outer districts of the town of Lomé. She has an income-generating activity selling "pagnes" (a West African term for decorative fabric), shoes and women's bags on a retail basis. She has been carrying out this activity since 2000. In order to have more customers she conducts her activity on a door-to-door basis. She is requesting a third loan to boost her stock by buying five cartons of bags and ten cartons of shoes.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and bags

loans.name: Massan
