texts.fr: A. massan a commencé en 2000 le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de notsè ainsi elle a une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. elle fait face à une demande élevée, elle veut s'approvisionner c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois. elle est veuve et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Massan A. started selling sacks of charcoal in 2000. She gets her supplies inland in the town of Notsé and thus has a higher profit margin on her sales. She is in great demand and would like to get fresh supplies. For this reason she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 sacks of charcoal. She is a widow and the income from her business allows her to cover her child's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Los Sánchez Group

texts.es:
El grupo los S. está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes han sido beneficiadas tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras su negocio por medio de un registro de las ventas, costos y ganancias e inversión. 
 
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María Luisa M. B. quien hace cuatro años empezó vendiendo frescos, helados y sopas en la actualidad gracias a los prestamos y sus deseos de superación tiene una pequeña venta. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 8 años, 5 años y un bebe de 4 meses por los cuales trabaja arduamente con el fin de progresar.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosibel S. de 24 años la cual se dedica a vender frijoles y nacatamales comida típica abase de maíz y cerdo, y Juana S. desde hace 15 años comercializa nacatamales, elotes, buñuelos, platanitos y tortillas.
texts.en:
The “Los S. Group” is made up of three hard working, entrepreneurial women who have greatly benefited from development and enablement programs such as “Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género;” “Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género;” “Intercambio Empresarial y Articulación de Actores.” This, as they tell us, has taught them to run their businesses by keeping records of their sales, costs, earnings, and investments. María Luisa M. B., the group’s coordinator, began selling fresh frozen treats and soup four years ago, and now has a small store thanks to these loans. She has four children, ages eight, five, and a four month old baby; for whom she works diligently to get ahead. The other members include Rosibel S., age 24, who sells beans and nacatamales (a typical food made with corn flour and pork); and Juana S., who has been selling nacatamales, corn, buñuelos, plantains, and tortillas for the past 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Tamemsusor Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsusor” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in a small village called Masorie, about 32 miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan that these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu S. (second from left).  Kadiatu is approximately age 42 and was born in Masorie. Her husband is a farmer and they have six children -  two attending primary school, two in secondary, one in college and one no longer attending school. 

For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling food items such as rice, palm-oil, salt and sugar. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will be able to expand her business size and quality by buying the above mentioned items at wholesale, to add to her current supplies.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm-oil, salt and sugar for resale

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El trabajo que realiza es la venta de comida, desde entonces y durante las mañanas prepara diferentes platillos y entre los más solicitados, está el ceviche, sudado de pescado, arroz con pato entre otros platillos peruanos; que tiene mucha demanda entre sus clientes. Ellos en su mayoría empleados y mecánicos que trabajan en los alrededores de su casa de Kelly, y a la hora de comer se llena su establecimiento.  Lo que más le complace de su negocio, es que lo realiza dentro de su casa, lo cual le permite estar cerca de su familia, además el es rentable y pueda cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. En adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y renovar su refrigeradora, para que pueda conservar las verduras y carnes que compra, de ese modo pueda preparar los alimentos en buen estado. Es el quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Kelly tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra de ollas de diversos tamaños, que le son de mucha utilidad en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Kelly, age 48, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. The work she does is selling food. In the mornings she prepares different dishes. Among the most requested are “ceviche” (raw fish cooked in lime juice), steamed fish, duck with rice, and other Peruvian dishes that are in great demand among her customers. Her customers are mostly employees and mechanics who work in the area around Kelly’s house. Her establishment fills up when it is time to eat. What gives her the most pleasure from her business is that she does her work in her house. This allows her to be close to her family. Also, it is profitable, and she is able to cover her children’s necessities. Later she plans to expand her store and replace her refrigerator in order to be able to preserve the vegetables and meat that she buys. This way she will be able to prepare fresh food. This is her 15th loan with MFP. She pledges to make her payments punctually. Kelly has plans to use the requested loan to buy different size pots, which will be very useful in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different size pots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To carry out work and buy fertlizers

loans.name: Marian Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Marian” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,400,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Marian (left) is the leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a businessman and they have four children. Marian has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells groundnut/peanuts, rice and palm oil (the country’s most favorite cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, rice and palm oil

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: La señora azucena tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y tambien  vende ropa usada los fines de semana, la señora tiene a su cargo a tres nietas y las ah sacado adelante y les a dado educación. Sus nietas le ayudan en la tienda de abarrotes cuando ella se tiene que ir a trabajar en la venta de ropa usada. La señora azucena es una mujer muy trabajadora y para mejorar sus ventas necesita reparar el techo de donde ella guarda la ropa que vende, ya que el techo esta muy deteriorado por  las lluevias.
texts.en:
Ms. Azucena runs a small grocery store and also sells second hand clothing. She has three granddaughters whom she cares for and whom she has moved ahead and educated. Her granddaughters help her in the grocery store when she has to leave to sell clothing. Ms. Azucena is a hard working woman and needs to repair the roof over the area where she stores the clothing that she sells. The roof is in very bad shape because of the rains.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Aura Liseth

texts.es:
Aura Liseth C. es una mujer humilde, trabajadora y esforzada quien inicio vendiendo perfumes Avon marca reconocida que trabaja vía catalogo. En la actualidad se dedica al comercio de ropa  con el cual mantiene a sus tres hijos de 9, 8 y 4 años y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida. 

Ella con el prestamo invertira en blusas, pantalones, jeans, camisetas, camisas...etc.
texts.en:
Aura Liseth C. is a humble, hard working woman who began selling Avon brand perfumes via catalog. Now she sells clothing, through which she and her husband support their children, ages 9, 8, and 4. She will use the money from this loan to invest in blouses, pants, jeans, t-shirts, shirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: cette dame s'est lancée en  1990 dans le commerce de détail des ustensiles de cuisine , elle s'approvisionne dans certains marchés locaux de lomé. Elle veut gonfler son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers ustensiles de cuisine, elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. elle est veuve et c'est avec le revenu de son activité qu'elle subvient aux charges de son enfant.
texts.en:
In 1990 this lady started selling kitchen utensils door-to-door. She buys them in neighborhood markets in Lome. She wants to build her inventory and so is asking WAGES for a loan to buy various cooking utensils. She is a traveling salesperson. She is a widow, and her income pays for her child's needs.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Massorie Progressive Union Group

texts.en: Umu S. K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umu was born in Masorie village, which is about 32 miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 37 years old. Umu is married to a farmer and the couple has five children, two of whom are in primary school and two in secondary school.  For many years now, Umu has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and pepper. This is not the first loan that Umu and her group members have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. With the help of this loan, Umu will use her share (SLL 1,000,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get the plowing done and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Tamansane Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesspeople in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 900,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 900,000 each, they will be able to add more stocks into their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feed and clothe them. 

Samuel I. K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. He was born in a village call Yoni, in Northern Sierra Leone. Samuel is age 35, married with two children who attend primary school. 

Samuel is a photographer. He has been in this profession for five years. He also sells locally produced items such as rice and palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). Samuel will use his share of the loan to buy film, rice, and palm oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy film, rice, and palm oil for resale

loans.name: Juana Teodora

texts.es:
Juana Teodora es una madre D. familia D. 68 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y su ultima hija en el distrito D. TambogranD.,un distrito agrícola que produce principalmente frutas para exportación, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicado a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores D. agricultura desD. hace muchos años, cuenta con media hectárea D. cultivo en donD. siembra mango, después D. cada temporada D. cosecha ella ofrece en venta las frutas que recolecta a las diversas plantas D. tratamiento que están ubicadas en la zona, estas fábricas están encargadas D. procesar las frutas para luego exportarlas. Este procedimiento es utilizado por la mayoría D. agricultores D. la zona, lo que hace que el cultivo D. frutas sea la principal actividad económica del lugar.

Juana desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo D. mango, para hacerlo se ha propuesto comprar fertilizantes que brinden mejores nutrientes a sus árboles frutales, lo que derivará en una buena cosecha. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su esposo y juntos sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Teodora is a 68 year old mother with a family. She is married and lives with her husband and youngest daughter in the TambogranD. agricultural district where fruit for export is the primary product. The district is a part of the Piura province within the region of the same name, which is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She’s been working in agriculture for many years. She has half a hectare of land where she raises mango. Following each harvest season, she offers for sale the fruit that she collects from the various treatment plants located throughout the zone. These factories are charged with processing the fruit for export. This process is used by most of the farmers in the zone, making the raising of fruit the chief economic activity. Juana would like to maintain her mango crop and to do it has proposed buying fertilizer that will offer nutrients to the fruit trees, producing a good harvest. In order to reach her goal, she has requested her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a hard working woman very dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue to work in order to help her husband move the family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel Z., es medico y presta sus servicios en un hospital, hace poco tiempo adquirió una vivienda de interés social donde vive actualmente. El y su esposa quieres hacerle unas mejoras  y colocar la barda en el frente de la casa, para mayor seguridad de su familia, ya que tiene hijos pequeños. El tiene un dinero que ah venido ahorrando desde tiempo atrás y solicita esta ayuda para terminar la barda de  todo el frente de su casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Manuel Z. is a doctor and provides his services in a hospital. He recently acquired a subsidized house where he currently lives. He and his wife would like to make some improvements and add a wall in front of the house so that the family will be more secure, especially since they have young children. He has some money that he’s saved, and is asking for this loan to be able to finish the wall all across the front of his property, which will improve the quality of life for his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of home

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
These women are small scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 1,200,000, they will be able to add more stock, make more sales and more profit. 

Salamatu K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group. Salamatu was born in Makeni. She is married to a businessman and they have five children. Two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school.

For many years now, the 36-year-old has been selling cooked rice, fish, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), groundnut/peanuts, etc. With the help of this loan, Salamatu will be able to expand her business by buying rice, fish, palm oil and groundnut at wholesale. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower, Wara F., who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy cooked rice, fish, palm oil, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith H. B., tiene la edad de 64 años, está casada, y 2 hijos. El crédito lo quiere para sembrar café y asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es sembrar en una área que está desocupada y comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Judith también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Judith H. B. is 64 years old and married with two children. She is requesting the loan to plant coffee and attend to her farm. She intends to buy fertilizer and plant her coffee on a plot of vacant land. She wants to maintain her coffee crops appropriately in order to achieve better quality and obtain the most income possible at harvest time. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the easiness of the process. In addition, Judith has worked in agriculture for many years. She hopes the future offers her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability and hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant coffee

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis de 51 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), el vende pescados desde hace años para mantener a sus 7 hijos y esposa. 

Una amigo de Luis le animo para que vendiera pescado ya que la falta de ingresos ocasionaba que su familia no viviera bien, con un dinero prestado comenzó a comprar y vender pescado, poco a poco pudo vender pescados por saco. Ahora el trabaja desde la mañana hasta las tardes vendiendo pescados como tilapia y corvinas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar para continuar con su negocio pescados de varios tipos y camarones. En el futuro el quiere comprar un solar para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is 51 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil (a suburban zone surrounded by the Guayaquil estuary). He has been selling fish for the past to years, in order to support his wife and seven children. One of Luis’ friends encouraged him to begin selling fish because he needed an income and his family didn’t live well. He borrowed some money and began buying and selling fish. Little by little he was able to sell fish by the sac. Now he works from morning to night, selling fish such as tilapia and corvina. He will use the money from this loan to buy various types of fish and shrimp to continue his business. In the future he would like to buy a lot on which he can build his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and shrimp for resale

loans.name: Wan Word Group

texts.en:
These women are members of the “Wan Word” group. They are small scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve. 

Agnes K. (left) is the leader of this group. Agnes was born in Makeni. She is 30 years old. Agnes is married with no children. Agnes sells dishes and bowls. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With her share of this loan, Agnes will buy a large quantity of bowls and dishes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bowls and dishes

loans.name: Edem Benedicte

texts.fr: cette dame s'est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce de détail tissus bazins et de cartes de recharges. elle réalise de bonnes recettes. voulant gonfler son stock pour acrroître son revenu et satisfaire la demande élevée de ses  clients, elle demande un premier prêt à WAGES afin de s'acheter 54 cartes de recharges, 10 tissus bazins et divers. elle est célibataire et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient à ses charges.
texts.en:
In 2007, this lady started a retail business selling bazin fabrics (a type of damask) and telephone recharge cards. She has a good turnover. In order to increase her stocks to boost her revenue and better cope with high customer demand, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase 54 recharge cards, 10 pieces of bazin, and miscellaneous items. She is a single woman who supports herself with the income from her business.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy telephone recharge cards, bazin fabrics, and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo. De lunes a sábado trabaja como cajera en un establecimiento, y durante la noche se dedica en la venta de productos energizantes. De esta manera se gana la vida, que cuando tiene más pedidos por parte de sus clientes, cita a cada uno de ellos en su domicilio para la orientación previa de la utilización de estos productos, que en su mayoría son bebidas. Generalmente sus compradores son sus compañeras de trabajo, quienes semanalmente le pagan, es por ello que se siente satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; ya lleva 6 años en este actividad y en adelante desea ampliar su negocio y abarcar nuevos mercados. Es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Dionisia tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita en el incremento de productos energéticos y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 50 years old; she lives in her own home with her husband and child. From Monday to Saturday, she works as a cashier in a store and during the night she sells energy products. That is her source of income and when she has more orders by her customers, she makes an appointment with each of them in her home and teaches them how to use the products, the majority are drinks. Generally her buyers are workmates who weekly pay her and that is why she is happy for the work that she does. She has sold her products for 6 years and in the future she wishes to expand her business and get in new markets. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and promises to pay all of the quotas on time since it helps her increase her work capital. Dionisia plans to use the loan to buy and increase her energetic drinks and to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy energy products.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor marco tiene un negocio de comidas, el se encarga de la educación de su sobrina y de su mama. Es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. A su sobrina la ah cuidado y educado como si fuera su hija, el requiere de la compra de una maquina de hielo y un asador de carne, para obtener mayores ingresos al vender otros tipos de comidas. El esta preocupado por el patrimonio de sus sobrina y les agradece su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Marco has a food business. He pays for his niece’s and mother’s education and is a hard working, enterprising man. He has provided his niece with an education as if she were his own daughter. He needs to buy an ice machine and a grill so that he can increase his income by selling a greater variety of food. He is worried about raising his niece and appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ice machine and grill

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es: La señora Norma Alicia Trabaja en una cafetería de una universidad, es una señora que le gusta mucho su trabajo y convivir con los estudiantes de la universidad, ella quiere mejorar su lugar de trabaja, es por eso que requiere de este crédito por que el techo de la cafetería ya esta muy dañado debido a las lluvias tan intensas que se han suscitado en la ciudad, y es necesario repararlo. Ella les agradece el apoyo.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Alicia works in a university cafeteria and is a woman who enjoys working and mingling with the university students. She wants to improve her work area, so she needs this loan because the roof in the cafeteria is damaged from the intense rains that have hit the city and the roof it is in need of repair. She appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof in her place of business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos de 27 años de edad vive en union libre con la joven Luisa Amanda Cruz on quien tiene una hija de nombre Cindhy de 7 añitos estudiando 1er grado de primaria. Juan Carlostrabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año, desempeñandose como  colector.  

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de cambiar el zinc y la madera del techo de su cuarto que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que con las lluvias se le mojan algunas cosas y desea evitar que su familia se enferme.  

Sueña con poder darle a su familia las condiciones necesarias de un hogar para que se sientan comodos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 27 years old and lives together with Luisa Amanda Cruz, with whom he has a seven year old daughter named Cindhy. She is in first grade. Juan Carlos has been working as a collector for the Juigalpa City Hall for a year. He is asking for this loan so that he can replace the zinc sheeting and wooden beams, which are in bad shape, over his room. He wants to prevent the rain water from leaking in and does not want his family to become ill. He wants to provide them with good living conditions so that they will be comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 46 años de edad vive en union libre con la Sra. Martha M. con quien tiene 2 hijos: Harvin de 18 años estudiando el 5to año de secundaria y Elizabeth de 15 en 4to año. Jaime trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 18 meses, desempeñandose como  conductor. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto, ya que desea brindarle privacidad a su hijo, ya que esta en una edad en la que la necesita.  

El mayor sueño de don Jaime es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en unos profesionales que saquen adelante a nuestro pais, ademas desea poder brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones basicas que se merecen.
texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Jaime lives in a common-law marriage with Señora Martha M.. They have two children: Harvin, 18, who is in his 5th year of secondary school and Elizabeth, 15, in her 4th year of secondary school. Jaime has worked for 18 months as a driver for the city of Juigalpa. He is requesting his first loan to add a room to his house. He wants to give privacy to his son, for he is now at the age where he needs it. The biggest dream of Don Jaime is to see his children become professionals and get our country moving forward. Also, he wants to give his family the decent standard of living that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a room to his house

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “WAYNA CCAPAC”; La  socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yessica, tiene 28 años D. edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene una pequeña botica, la socia estudió farmacia en la universidad y con mucho esfuerzo pudo reunir un capital para abrir su botica, ella venD. todo tipo D. productos relacionados a la salud; tiene 1 año con este su negocio y le está yendo muy bien, el papá D. su hijo trabaja en la municipalidad D. Maras y le envía dinero para que su pequeño pueda tener su alimentación diaria, la socia sueña con agrandar su negocio y por esta razón ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería (medicamentos) a cuenta ella pagará una primera inicial que poco a poco irá pagando. 

Los otros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta D. productos secos, mozos en restaurantes, crianza D. animales, los mismos que son vendidos a los mercados, tienda D. abarrotes.
 
Los socios valoran y agradecen infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este les permite crecer con sus negocios y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “WAYNA CCAPAC” communal bank. She lives in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. Her name is Yessica, and she is 28 years old and a single mother. She runs a small pharmacy; she studied pharmacy at the university, and with much effort, she was able to assemble enough capital to open her pharmacy. She sells all types of health-related products. She has operated this business for 1 year, and it is going very well for her. The father of her child works in the municipality of Maras, and he sends her money for the little one's daily sustenance. Yessica dreams of expanding her business, and for this reason she is requesting the loan, so that she can buy merchandise (medicines) on credit; she will make an initial deposit and gradually pay off the rest. The other group members pursue a range of activities, such as selling dry goods, working as a waiter in a restaurant, raising animals to sell in the market, or operating a grocery store. The members infinitely value and appreciate the loan granted to them, since it will allow them to expand their businesses and improve their quality of life; accordingly, they are committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise (medicines)

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr:
Fatou Bintou S. est une femme de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus Bazin et thioup. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 30 mètres de tissus Bazin, 12 pièces de thioup et de l'encens. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 22 novembre 2007 et a reçu 5 fois de suite de crédit. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou S. is a thirty-eight year old married woman and the mother of one child. She has built up a small business selling Bazin (cotton Damask) and Thioup (hand-dyed) fabrics. Her new loan will enable her to buy 30 meters of Bazin fabric, 12 pieces of Thioup and some incense. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS "Banc Villageois” since November 22, 2007 and has received five consecutive loans. Her goal is to contribute financially to the support of her family while increasing her level of savings.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy BAZIN and THIOUP fabric and incense

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan Ramon de 33 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Rosa Natalia Amador con quien tiene 2 niñas: Natalia de 10 años estudiando 5to grado de primaria y Crystel de 2 añitos. Juan Ramon trabaja para el Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa desde hace 10 años, desempeñandose como  responsable de almacen medico. 

Esta solicitando  refinanciamiento su 11vo credito con el objetivo de levantar 2 paredes y lograr tener un anexo para su casa y brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.  Cabe señalar que el credito anterior fue beneficiado con el fondo kiva y logro instalar la energia electrica a su cuarto y levantar una pared.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es que sus hijas estudien y poder brindarle las condiciones necesarias para que crezcan en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Juan Ramon, 33, and his wife, Sra. Rosa Natalia Amador, have 2 daughters: Natalia, 10, a fifth-year student at a local elementary school and Crystel, 2. Juan Ramon has worked for the Hospital Asuncion de Juigalpa for 10 years. He is responsible for the hospital's medical supply stores. Juan Ramon is applying for his 11th loan. He will use the loan to put up 2 walls and finish building a room on his house, a project that he wants to do so that his family can live more comfortably. He says that, thanks to the last loan that he received from Kiva, he was able to put up one wall and install electricity in the room. Juan Ramon's greatest wishes are that his daughters go to school and that they get everything they need to grow up in a safe and happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish addition to house.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina, divorced with a two-year-old son, has been selling women's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol, Ukraine for the past six years. Assisted by her parents who provided her with some initial working capital, over time Irina has developed her business and gained loyal customers. Today, she has 20,000 UAH in inventory, and her monthly net profit is about 4,500 UAH.  Irina would now like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase the range of her inventory, hoping to make additional profit and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Khardiatou

texts.fr:
Khardiatou S. est une femme âgée de 26 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant.

Elle est vendeuse de fruits. Elle achète des fruits dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa zone pour aller revendre à Dakar. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBAN FASS depuis le 22 novembre 2007. Elle a 5 fois de suite reçu et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Son nouveau prêt de 500.000 francs lui permettra d'acheter 100 bassines de fruitset des cartons pour les emballages. Parallèlement elle fait un petit commerce de balais.

Son objectif est de de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de constituer une épargne consistante.
texts.en:
Khardiatou S. is a 26 years old woman. She is single without children. She sells fruits. She purchases fruits at the weekly market in her region and travels to Dakar to resell them. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Coloban Fass since Novembe 22, 2007. Her new loan of 500,000 [West African] francs will allow her to purchase 100 baskets of fruit and packaging boxes. In addition, she sells brooms. Her goal is to be able to support herself and maintain a constant level of savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits [for resale]

loans.name: Liuli

texts.es: Liuli, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijas y su nieta. Tiene dos oficios, durante el día trabaja como empleada del hogar y por las tardes vende productos de belleza.  En este último trabajo, sus ventas lo realiza previamente mediante catalogo, mostrando a sus vecinas y amistades de trabajo, de esa manera le hacen el pedido y tener que esperar cierto tiempo hasta que le traigan el producto en demanda, puesto que el no contar con suficiente presupuesto no le permite tener productos en stock.  Lleva 3 meses esta labor y esta muy contenta con el negocio que realiza. Sus planes a futuro es tener una tienda, en donde pueda dedicarse su hija que se encuentra desempleada, además considera que es más rentable que el negocio actual que tiene, por otra parte construir su casa a base de material noble. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas, además se siente satisfecha con sus compañeras de grupo por lo responsables que son. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar estantes y productos para instalar su tienda y de ese modo su hija se dedique en ella.
texts.en:
Liuli, 40, lives with her 2 daughters and a granddaughter in a house that she owns. She has two jobs. During the day she works as a housekeeper and in the evenings she sells beauty products. She sells beauty products from catalogs, showing the products to her friends and neighbors who then order from her. Liuli doesn't have enough money to keep products in stock, so she only orders products when she has a firm order from her customers. Consequently, she and they to wait a time for the products to arrive. Liuli has operated the business for 3 months and she is very happy with it. In the future, she would like to have a store where her daughter, who is unemployed, could work. She also thinks it would be more profitable than her current operation. In addition to her goals for the business, Liuli would like to make improvements to her house. This is her fifteenth MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She says, too, that she is pleased with the other members of her group because they have demonstrated that they are responsible. Liuli will use the loan to buy shelving and products to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise and supplies for beauty products business.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 3 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of her group, "Mujeres Poderosa 3" ("Powerful Women 3"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenges were raising her children all by myself. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to sing and helping others.

Luz plans to use this loan to invest in her fruit stand, by buying coconuts, plantains, banana, cane, and other fruits. She will use the profits to invest in her business and she dreams of improving it and being able to help others. She has had her business for one year, starting with $27 US that she saved.  Luz is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. 

Luz's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy coconut, plantains, cane and all kind of fruits for her fruit stand

loans.name: Marcia  Emeldy

texts.es: Marcia  Emeldy  R. H. de 26, vive junto a su padre de 64 años de edad, su madre de 60 años y junto a sus dos hermanos menores de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Marcia reside en San Alejo, ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. Ella trabaja comercializando ropa para damas, y ropa para niñas, su forma de venderla es ambulante y la ofrece por diferentes cantones de San Lorenzo, en donde realiza muy buenas ventas ya que es ropa muy vistosa, la cual le gusta a las personas, así también tiene un precio bastante accesible. Marcia realiza este trabajado desde hace 2 años atrás con el deseo de poder superarse y de esta manera correr con todos sus gastos personales y así ayudar a sus padres. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de ropa, tanto formal como informal para dama y mayor variedad para niños, de esta forma Mariana se asegura vender más ya que podrá abarcar los gustos de la mayoría de personas y así mismo suplir algunas necesidades.
texts.en:
Marcia Emeldy R. H. is 26 years old and lives with her 64 year old father, her 60 year old mother, and her two young brothers who attend school. Marcia lives in San Alejo, located in the La Unión department. She sells ladies’ and girls’ clothing on foot throughout the different San Lorenzo neighborhoods. She has good sales because it’s nice clothing and people like it. She also has good prices. Marcia has been doing this work for the past two years in order to move ahead and be able to cover all of her personal expenses and be able to help out her parents. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest into her business by buying ladies’ informal garments and a variety of children’s clothing in quantity. In this way Marcia can increase her sales because she will be able to meet most people’s likings and needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

location.town: San Alejo, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one son. She also takes care of her elderly parents and helps them with what they need.

Svetlana sells food at a market that is located close to a railway station. She has been in this business for 13 years. Her income is 3,500 UAH per month.

Svetlana is a very open, enthusiastic and responsible person. She has used small business loans several times and always paid them back on time. This time, Svetlana would like to obtain a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to sell more and generate additional income.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory

loans.name: Flor Estela

texts.es: Flor Estela M. D. R. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el pueblo D. Cojutepeque, el cual se encuentra en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 16, 14 y 13 años D. edad, el compañero D. Flor resiD. en Los Estados Unidos, razón por la que debe trabajar muy duro para salir adelante junto a sus hijos ya que la ayuda que recibe D. su esposo es poca. Flor se dedica a la venta D. verduras, las cuales comercializa en el mercado D. Cojutepeque, un lugar en el cual esta rodeada D. un gran número D. ventas, y así mismo D. mucha competencia, razón por la que ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su puesto en el mercado, ofreciendo mayor cantidad D. verduras, así mismo desea comprar diferentes tipos D. frutas, y D. esta forma poder asegurar más ventas. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a lo que hace D. lunes a domingo vendiendo durante todo el día con la esperanza D. poder obtener excelentes ganancias, las cuales sean D. mucha ayuda para su hogar y sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Flor Estela M. D. R. D. is 34 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque, which is located in the Cuscatlán department. She lives with her three children, ages 16, 14, and 13 and must work very hard in order to get ahead with her children because husband lives in the United States and she receives only a little support from him. Flor sells vegetables in the Cojutepeque market, an area which is surrounded by other salespeople, so she has lots of competition. She is requesting this loan, so that she can stock her stall to be able to offer a greater variety of vegetables. She would also like to offer different types of fruits and in this way be able to guarantee greater sales. She is a hard working woman who is dedicated to her work seven days a week, selling all day in hopes of obtaining good earnings, which are very helpful to her household and three children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Deisi Lorena

texts.es: Deisi Lorena C. D. R. D. 36 años D. edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta formado por su esposo, un hombre muy trabajador y responsable y sus dos hijos D. 10 y 9 años D. edad. Deisi es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, la cual siempre esta en busca del bienestar D. esta, ella trabaja en su propio taller D. costura, en el cual se dedica a elaborar prendas D. vestir, así mismo posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, y en donD. trabaja desD. hace 6 años atrás, por poder vender todo lo esencial que las personas necesitan en su hogar y así tener complacidos a sus clientes y con la esperanza D. contar con otros nuevos. Este negocio es el que le permite obtener mayores ganancias, razón por la que solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en ella, comprando productos comestibles como leche, huevos, pan, golosinas, y otros más y así mismo surtirlo D. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar como: jabón, desinfectantes, medicinas y otras más. D. esta forma ella espera superar a su competencia, contando con mayor variedad y así ser la primera opción para los posibles compradores, esperando mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Deisi Lorena C. D. R. is 36 years old and lives with her family, which includes her husband, a hard working, responsible man; and her two children, ages 10 and 9. Deisi is very dedicated to her family and is always looking out for their well being. She works in her own tailor shop where she manufactures articles of clothing. She has also been running a general store out of her home for the past six years, where she also sells perishable items. She tries to carry all of the essential items that people need in their homes in order to please all of her customers and be able to attract new ones. This is the business that produces most of her income. She is asking for this loan so that she can have the money to invest in the business, by buying milk, eggs, bread, sweets, and other things. She also wants to increase her sales by supplying her business with a variety of other personal need items, such as soap, disinfectant, medications, and other things. She hopes to beat out her competition by offering a greater variety and become their first choice.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es: Deysi del Carmen R. T. de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida y junto a un hijo el cual depende de ella. Reside en el municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Deysi es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atiende de la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, así mismo trabaja elaborando y vendiendo tortillas, las cuales comercializa con sus amigos y vecinos y personas de los alrededores. Deysi solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y de esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesario en el hogar, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de maíz con el fin de elaborar más tortillas y de esta forma atender a más personas. Lo que más desea Deysi es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando de poder ganarse la vida de una forma segura.
texts.en:
Deysi del Carmen R. T. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and one son who depends on her for support. She lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department. Deysi is very well known and comes with very good references from her neighbors, not only for being responsible, but also for being very friendly and providing the best service to her customers. She runs a grocery store out of her home and also makes and sells tortillas to her friends, neighbors, and to other people. Deysi is asking for a loan so that she can have the working capital with which to stock her store with a variety of items. In this way she can offer basic need items for the home, and also be able to buy corn in bulk, which she can use to make more tortillas. In this way she can attend to her customers’ needs. What Deysi really wants is to be able to improve her economic stability and take advantage of her life’s opportunity to earn a living in a reliable manner.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr:
Aïssatou C. est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est veuve et mère 06 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres enfants confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce d'huile de palme, de miel et de jus de citron. Elle fait le tour des villages dans Ziguinchor pour acheter sa marchandise. Pour la vente elle va à Dakar.

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001. Elle a 18 fois de suite était bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle n'a jamais eu de problème remboursement. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter de l'huile de palme, du miel et du jus de citron.

Avec ses bénéfices elle participer à l'alimentation de la famille, au payement de la scolarité des enfants et à la santé.
texts.en:
Aïssatou C. is 59-years old. She is a widow, mother of six children, and guardian of three other children placed in her care by relatives. She runs a small business selling palm oil, honey and lemon juice. She buys her stocks in the villages of Ziguinchor, and sells her goods in Dakar. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of COLOBANE FASS since February 19, 2001. She has previously received 18 consecutive loans, all of which she repaid without incident. This new loan will allow her to buy palm oil, honey and lemon juice. She will use her profits to feed her family and to pay for the children’s tuition and for healthcare.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil, honey and lemon juice

loans.name: La Cuahutemoc Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama la cuauhtemoc decidieron  ponerle este nombre puesto que asi se llama la colonia donde viven y todas los integrantes pertenecen a esta misma.
La historia es acerca de la señora Yolanda N. H., ya que es la representante del grupo, ella es casada su esposo se llama Pedro, cuenta con 30 años de edad y aun no tienen hijos, se dedica a la venta de tamales, carne enchilada y chorizo.
 
Yolanda se decidió por ese negocio ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda ya que únicamente vende en su casa y le deja muy buenas ganancias, además tiene muchos clientes, ella ya lleva mas de 5 años con su  negocio e invirtirá su crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos como son: tomates, chiles, ajos, hojas, condimentos y la carne ya que es lo que mas necesita. 
 
Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio ella esta ahorrando para  construir uN. barda a su casa y también esta apoyando a su esposo con el sustento de la casa aunque no son muchos los gastos ya que solamente son ellos dos
 
Comenta que su negocio ésta beneficiando a los vecinos de su colonia, ya que no hay muchas personas que vendan ahí cerca, puesto que todas se van a vender al mercado y ella aprovecha por que algunos de sus vecinos no les gusta salir hasta el centro y así que como ella esta mas cerca van a comprar ahí, también por la atención y servicio que les brinda. 
 
El sueño de doña Yolanda es el de construir un local ahí mismo en su casa para poner uN. carnicería y también quiere tener hijos.
 
Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables y pagadoras ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien.
 
Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.
 
Los integrantes del grupo "Cuauhtemoc" y las actividades a las que se dedican son:
Yolanda N. H.-venta de tamales y carne (representante)
JorgiN. Vázquez-perfumería
Ruperto macedonio garcía N.-pescadería
Guadalupe M. Pérez-polleria
Celsa victoriaN. Rodríguez Martínez-deposito de refrescos
Inés margarita López Gutiérrez-club nutricional
Nicasio López R.-agua de garrafón
Apolonia Hernández S.-tienda de ropa
MarceliN. López R.-perfumería
Epifanía M.-antojitos
Silvia López López-taller de costura
ReiN. Z. Juárez-pescadería
texts.en:
This group is called “Cuahutemoc” because it is the name of the neighborhood where all of the members reside. The focus of this description will be the story of Sra. Yolanda N. H., the group representative. She is 30 years old and married to her husband Pedro. They still do not have children. Yolanda sells tamales, meat enchiladas, and chorizo sausage.

Yolanda decided to pursue this business of the great demand that exists. She only sells from home and is able to generate good earnings since she has many customers. Yolanda has already been in business for five years and will invest her loan in the purchase of more ingredients used in making her products. Tomatoes, chili peppers, garlic, banaN. leaves, condiments, and meat are the items that she needs the most.

With the profits from her business, Yolanda is saving toward the construction of a security wall around her house. She also supports her husband with maintaining their household since they have many expenses between the two of them.

She says that her business is a benefit to the neighbors in her area since there are few people who sell locally. All of the vendors sell at the market, so she takes advantage of the few residents who do not like to travel to the center of town. In addition to being close to her neighbors, she is known for the attention and service that she provides. Doña Yolanda dreams of adding a space to her house where she can open a butcher shop. She also wants to have children.

Yolanda says the members of her group are very responsible people who complete their payments on time. They know one another and get along very well. She is extremely grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva for their support by providing this loan. Her business is improving as a result of this assistance.

The members of the Cuahutemoc Group and their business activities are listed below: • Yolanda N. H., group representative – sells tamales and meat • JorgiN. Vázquez – sells perfumes • Ruperta Macedonio García N. – sells fish • Guadalupe M. Pérez – sells chickens • Celsa VictoriaN. Rodríguez Martínez – sells soft drinks out of a warehouse • Inés Margarita López Gutiérrez – sells nutritional products through a membership club • Nicasio López R. – sells jugs of water • Apolonia Hernández S. – manages a clothing store • MarceliN. López R. – sells perfumes • Epifanía M. – sells snacks • Silvia López López – operates a sewing workshop • ReiN. Z. Juárez – sells fish

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, chili peppers, garlic, banana leaves, condiments, and meat

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has one child. She sells curtains and accessories at Image Market in Beregovo city. Her monthly gross income is 20,000 UAH; the profit is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana started this business 8 years ago. She was lucky to choose this type of goods to sell, because she had very little competition then, and even now the competition is low. This gives Svetlana a good opportunity to make her living. Svetlana is a kind and hard-working person. She treats her clients well and has a desire to develop her business even more.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Additional capital would allow her to offer a better assortment of curtains and serve even more clients.

loans.use: To increase her curtain inventory

loans.name: César Antonio

texts.es: César Antonio M. L. de 20 años de edad, es un joven muy visionario y emprendedor el cual cuenta con su propio taller de corte y confección, el reside en el departamento de San Salvador junto a su madre la cual trabaja como comerciante. César elabora ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo elabora ropa para camas y cortinas, el elabora la ropa en su casa, lugar en el cual tiene sus maquinas de coser, y luego las comercializa con sus vecinos y amigos y de esta mismo forma las vende en diferentes puntos del país comercializándolas de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y cantones. A pesar de su corta edad César trabaja muy duro para poder ayudar a su madre a salir adelante, él se ha vuelto una gran ayuda para ella y de esta forma contar con todo lo necesario. Es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de tela, en diferentes estampados y colores, así mismo para comprar hilo y botones y todo lo necesario para invertir en su taller de costura y elaborar más trabajo para comercializa en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
César Antonio M. L. is 20 years old and has his own sewing business. He is an entrepreneur and a young man with great vision. He lives in the department of San Salvador with his mother, who works as a merchant. César makes clothing for men, women and children. He also makes bedding and curtains. He makes his clothing at home where he has his sewing machines and then he markets them with his friends and neighbors. He travels to different neighborhoods and cantons in different areas of the country to sell them. In spite of his young age, César works very hard to provide for his mother. He has become a great help to her and she has all that she needs. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan so that he can have the capital to invest in his business. He will buy a larger quantity of fabric in different prints and colors, thread, buttons and all that is necessary for his sewing business so he can make more clothing and sell in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and buttons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement to finish her house and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa M. T. de 49 años de edad, posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encarga de elaborar prendas de vestir, estas las elabora por pedidos previos que sus vecinos o amigos le hacen, así mismo elabora cortinas, manteles, y ropa de cama, las cuales comercializa por diferentes colonias y residenciales en la capital del país. Blanca reside en Soyapango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su pequeño nieto de 6 años de edad, el cual es la mayor razón para ella de salir adelante, ya que todo lo que hace lo trata de hacer de la mejor manera y de la mejor calidad para poder vender más y obtener nuevos clientes, ya que de esta forma ella puede obtener más ganancias y así darle todo lo que su nieto necesita. Blanca cuenta con muy buenas referencias ya que es una persona de muy buenos sentimientos, amable y respetuosa. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar telas, botones, hilos de diferentes colores y todo lo esencial para desempeñar su trabajo y  elaborar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales sean de mucho beneficio para ella y su nieto.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is 49 years old and has a dressmaking shop in which she designs and makes clothing. She sews them to fulfill previous orders from her neighbors or friends. Blanca also makes curtains, table clothes, and bed clothes, that she sells in different residential neighborhoods in the country's capital. Blanca resides in Soyapango with her little 6-year-old grandson, who is the main reason she wants to get ahead. Everything she does she tries to do in the best manner possible and with the best quality, to be able to sell more and obtain new clients, so that she can earn more and provide all that her grandson needs. Blanca has very good references and is a kind and respectful person with very good sentiments. She is soliciting a loan so that she can buy cloth, buttons, threads of different colors, and all the essentials to carry out her work and make a larger quantity of products, which will be of much benefit to her and her grandson

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CLOTH, BUTTONS, AND THREAD TO SEW DRESSES TO SELL

loans.name: Blanca Mariana

texts.es: Blanca Mariana M. D. Z. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo D. 46 años D. edad, quien trabaja como mecánico y junto a sus dos hijos menores D. edad quienes estudian educación básica. La señora Blanca posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación y en donD. también posee una pupusería, las cuales se encarga D. hacer cada noche durante toda la semana. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Blanca no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su esposo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar gran parte D. sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, las cuales le permiten contar con algunas ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Blanca Mariana M. D. Z. is 34 years old. She lives in the town of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her husband, who is 46 and who works as a mechanic, and with her two minor children who are in school. Blanca has a store which is located in her house, and she also sells pupusas, which she makes every weeknight. She is asking for a loan to be financially able to diversify her business. Blanca does not have the money to do this and it is neceesary for her and her husband because the store allows them to pay for a big part of the family expenses. She wants to diversify the store with products such as detergent, canned foods, bread, candies, beverages, and other products. These are basic home necessities and are what people ask for the most in the store. The loan will also be to buy a greater quantity of ingredients to make the pupusas, which allow her to make a little more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessity merchandise

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr:
Oumy KOUTYATE est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est aussi tutrice d'un enfant. 

Elle est vendeuse de thioup. Elle s'approvisionne au Mali pour revendre à Ziguinchor. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 20 mars 2003. Elle a 14 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 350.000 francs CFA. Elle paye des frais de voyage et de dédouanement pour un montant de 50.000 francs CFA. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Oumy KOUTYATE is 44 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is also the guardian of a child. Oumy sells Thioup (a hand-dyed fabric). She gets her stock in Mali to sell at Ziguinchor. She has been a member of the COLOBANE FASS "Banc Villageois” since March 20, 2003 and has received 14 consecutive loans. She has never had any problem with repaying. She is going to buy 350,000 francs CFA worth of fabric with this new loan. Her goal is to contribute financially to the children’s food, health care and school expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Thioup fabric

loans.name: Arikle Yobana

texts.es: Arikle Yobana A. B. de 34 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica en gran manera a su negocio, debido a que este es el que le permite brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, el cual esta conformado por su madre, la cual es ama de casa, su abuela, una hija y dos hermanos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Arikle se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, las cuales son uno de los platillos típicos más conocidos en el país y los cuales poseen más demanda, estas las elabora por las noches aprovechando mucho más los fines de semana que son cuando más se venden. Así mismo durante el día vende fruta, la cual comercializa pelada y cortada en trocitos preparadas con sal y limón, su madre le ayuda a preparar parte de los alimentos  y de esta forma ellas se ganan la vida. Arikle solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder comprar maíz por mayor, así mismo comprar queso, chicharrón, frijoles y todo lo necesario para elaborar las deliciosas pupusas, así mismo para comprar mayor cantidad de frutas. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para Arikle y su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan para salir adelante, por lo que es muy importante mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Arikle Yobana is 34 years old and a hard-working woman, who is very dedicated to her business. It's what makes it possible to offer necessities to her family, which is composed of her mother, who is a housewife, her grandmother, a daughter and two younger brothers, who are students. Arikle makes “pupusas”, one of the best known of El Salvador's typical dishes, which is in great demand. She makes them at night, and takes advantage of weekends when they sell best. In addition, during the day, she sells fruit, peeled and cut in slices with salt and lemon. Her mother helps her by preparing part of the food, and in this way they earn their living. Arikle is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy corn at wholesale, plus cheese, sausage, beans, and all the necessities to make delicious pupusas, and to buy a larger quantity of fruit. This business is of great importance for Arikle and her family, since it is the only source of income they can count on to get ahead, and it's very important to improve each day.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BASIC FOODS TO MAKE TYPICAL "PUPUSAS" AND FRUIT TO SELL

loans.name: Elsa Concepción

texts.es: Elsa Concepción M. D. V. D. 48 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 21 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a trabajar. Elsa vive en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual también desarrolla su trabajo. Ella se dedica junto a su esposo a comprar chatarra y hierro, la cual posteriormente comercializa por mayor, cada día salen en su pick up a comprar o recoger la chatarra y así mismo la reparten por colonias como Alta Vista, Soyapango, Ilopango y otras más las cuales se encuentran siempre ubicadas en el departamento D. San Salvador. Esta es la forma en que tanto Elsa como su esposo se ganan la vida, es por ello que dependen en gran manera D. este para salir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo para contar con el monto necesario para invertir en el negocio y así sacarlo adelante, ella desea poder comprar hierro y chatarra por mayor y D. esta forma poderle ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes al venderla. El mayor deseo D. Elsa y el D. su esposo es el D. contar con una vida más estable en la cual cuenten con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Elsa Concepción M. D. V., age 48, lives with her husband and their 21 year old son. Their son works. Elsa lives in the San Salvador department, and she works there as well. She and her husband buy scrap materials and iron, which they later sell wholesale. Everyday they go in their pick-up to buy or gather the scrap material. They also distribute it in neighborhoods like Alta Vista, Soyapango, Ilopango, and others; which are always located in the San Salvador department. This is the way that Elsa and her husband earn a living. That is why they greatly depend on it to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to have the needed money to invest in her business and get it ahead. She wants to be able to buy iron and scrap materials wholesale. That way she will be able to offer a greater quantity for her customers to buy. Elsa and her husband’s greatest wish is to have a more stable life where they have all of the necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron and scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Mirna Yanira

texts.es: Mirna Yanira M. D. D. D. 32 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como profesor D. natación y junto a sus dos hijos D. 10 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar, ella vive junto a su familia en Antiguo Cuscatlán, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Mirna posee una venta D. productos deportivos, como zapatos, trajes D. baño, todo lo relacionado con la natación, ya que su negocio esta ubicado en el polideportivo D. Merliot, mismo lugar en el cual su esposo da las clases D. natación, debido al buen desempeño del esposo D. Mirna en su trabajo, le fue concedido un pequeño local para poder colocar una tienda D. accesorios como sandalias, y así mismo bebidas como: agua y sodas, esto ha sido una gran oportunidad, ya que le ha brindado una nueva fuente D. ingresos para su familia. Mirna solicita un préstamo para poder comprar zapatos tenis, D. una marca en especifico, así mismo comprar más trajes D. baño, tablas para las clases D. natación y otros productos más los cuales venD. muy bien en el lugar. El mayor deseo D. Mirna es el D. poder aprovechar al máximo la oportunidad brindada y D. esta forma mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna Yanira M. D. D. is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, a swimming instructor, and their two children. The children are ten and seven years old, and they go to school. She lives with her family in Antiguo Cuscatlán, which is located in the La Libertad department. Mirna sells sporting goods like shoes, bathing suits, and everything having to do with swimming. Her business is located in the Merliot sports center, which is the same place where her husband teaches swimming. Due to her husband’s good work, she was granted a small place. She was able to set up a store with accessories like sandals. She also sells drinks like water and soda. This has been a great opportunity because it has been a new source of income for her family. Mirna is requesting loan to be able to buy a specific brand of tennis shoes. She will also buy more bathing suits, kick boards for swimming class, and other products; which sell very well at her place. Mirna’s greatest wish is to be able to take maximum advantage of the opportunity offered in order to improver her quality of life as well as her family’s.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes, kick boards for swimming, and other products

location.town: Antiguo Cuscatlán, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Taï

texts.fr:
Taï D. est une femme de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements. Une activité qu'elle mène depuis plus de 05 ans. Comme activité secondaire elle fait la vente de bijoux en or plaqué. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar et revend à Ziguinchor. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 19 février 2001. Elle a 18 fois reçu de crédit et a toujours bien remboursé. Elle vend souvent à crédit et fait ses recouvrements à la fin de chaque mois. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 38 ensembles de vêtement, 20 colliers en plaqué or. 

Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants, à leur habillement  et à la prise en charge de leur santé.
texts.en:
Taï D. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children. She has a small business involving clothing that she has been running for five years. As a secondary business, she sells gold-plated jewelry. She purchases her goods from Dakar and resells them in Ziguinchor. Taï has been a member of the Banc Villageois of COLOBANE FASS since February 19, 2001. She has received a loan eighteen times and has always repaid them. She often sells on credit and collects payment at the end of each month. With her new loan, she is going to buy 38 outfits and 20 gold-plated necklaces. She is helping to cover her children's schooling costs, as well as their clothing and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 38 outfits and 20 necklaces to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos G. D. M. D. 39 años D. edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por dos hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar, ella vive en Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, Santos posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad para el hogar, dicha venta esta ubicada frente al Instituto San Andrés, en donD. venD. la mayoría D. sus productos con los estudiantes D. este lugar y así mismo comercializa granos básicos con los empleados D. una fabrica cercana. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias justas para poder pagar la cuota mensual D. su casa y así mismo pagar todos los gastos D. la familia y el hogar, y así también contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Santos desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Santos ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos G. D. M. is 39 years old. She lives with her family, which is comprised of two children. The children work. She lives in Colón, which is located in the La Libertad department. Santos has a store where she sells perishable products and basic needs products for the home. Her store is located in front of the Instituto San Andrés. She sells most of her products to the students in the area. She also sells basic grains to the employees of a nearby factory. This business has allowed her to count on fair earnings in order to make the monthly house payment, pay for all of the family and household expenses, and to have food and all of the necessities to live decently. That is why Santos wants to have more products in the store. That is the reason she is requesting a loan to be able to buy rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other things that a good store carries. This is very important to Santos because there is a lot of competition in the area. That is why she needs to have everything that is necessary to satisfy her customers. Then she will win other customers who prefer to shop in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food products and basic grains

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia C. D. M. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Aguilares en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja comercializando granos básicos, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos D. 17, 15 y 4 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y la menor D. ellos siempre acompaña a Silvia en su negocio. Ella posee una sala D. belleza en la cual se encarga D. hacer cortes D. cabello, faciales, tintes y otros servicios más. DesD. hace varios años atrás que ella desempeña esta profesión, en la cual ha ido adquiriendo gran experiencia, lo que le permite desempeñar un gran trabajo y así contar con una basta clientela. Silvia es una persona muy visionaria y trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio, incrementando la cantidad D. productos como tratamientos para el cabello, cosméticos, cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo y otros productos más los cuales sus clientes solicitan bastante. D. esta manera Silvia garantiza un mejor servicio, con el cual pueda mantener a gusto a todos sus clientes y así contar siempre con trabajo, el cual es muy importante para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia C. D. M. is 35 years old, lives in the municipality of Aguilar in the La Libertad department with her husband (who sells grain), as well as their three children ages 17, 15 and 4. The children are in school though the youngest accompanies her father at work. Silvia has a beauty salon where she offers services such as hair cuts, facials, color and more. She has been doing this for several years and has gained lots experience which allows her to do a good job and have a large client base. Silvia is visionary, hard working and wishes to improve her business by expanding the hair products, cosmetics, body lotions, shampoos and other products available and requested by her clients. In that manner Silvia hopes to guarantee better service, keep her customers happy and thus have steady work which is very important to her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Mercedes Guadalupe

texts.es: Mercedes Guadalupe M. D. R. D. 40 años D. edad, vive junto a su familia la cual esta formada por su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante, y junto s sus tres hijos D. 14, 13 y 2 años D. edad. Ella vive junto a su familia en el municipio D. Aguilares, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Mercedes posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su misma casa D. habitación, lo cual trae mucho beneficios, ya que pueD. dedicarse a su negocio al mismo tiempo que se dedica a sus hijos y a los quehaceres del hogar. Su negocio es uno D. los más surtidos del lugar y que cuenta con mayor cantidad D. clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Mercedes solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad D. cada producto, y D. esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad D. clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho D. poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Guadalupe Martinez D. R. is 40 years old and lives with her husband (who is in sales) and their three children ages 14, 13, and 2. She and her family live in the municipality of Aguilares in the San Salvador department. Mercedes has a store selling basic needs and perishable items, which is located in her home. This is quite beneficial since she can run the business while looking after her kids and tending to household chores. Her business is one of the best stocked in the area with the most customers due to the excellent service and reasonable prices. Mercedes is requesting a loan through which she can invest in her business, increasing inventories and so better serve her customers. She is a very responsible woman who is very thankful to have her own business that allows her to meet her children's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable items to invest in her store

loans.name: Fogalua

texts.en:
