Fogalua M. C. is 54 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Fogalua has 1 year of experience in this business.  Fogalua needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Fogalua joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Fogalua's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Punitai

texts.en:
Punitai T. K. is 32 and married with 5 children (ages 12 - 21).  She owns a business venture selling baked goods in the local community.  Punitai has many years of experience in this business. Punitai needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Punitai joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Punitai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD. Since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en:
Tufa P. is 53 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro, which she then sells.  Tufa has four years of experience in this business.  She needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use her earnings (estimated to be 400 talas or US$167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Tufa joined SPBD.  This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tufa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii and Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario Group

texts.en:
Rosalia is the coordinator of her group, Desarrollo Comunitario 4 (Community Development). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to travel to the USA. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work.

Rosalia is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over four years. She started with a loan from her brother to sell food. Now she has been using Esperanza loans for 3 years. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying shoes and baby clothing. She will use the profits to buy a radio, to build her house and to buy some animals to sell (she lives in a rural area so it is easy for her to raise animals like cows and pigs). Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to give them a safer and comfortable life.
 
This Esperanza associate began working with us because Esperanza believes in business and we want to improve our businesses. Rosalia's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Shoes and baby clothing

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 31 años de edad, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Al quedarse sola, tuvo que luchar para poder mantener sola a sus hijos. Desde entonces se ha dedicado a varias actividades y gracias a su arduo esfuerzo pudo instalar una bodega, situada en el interior de su casa. Es así que su negocio esta Implementado de varios productos así como productos perecibles entre carnes y verduras.  Por otro lado, con los ahorros que logró pudo comprarse una moto, el cual lo alquila y otras veces su hijo mayor lo utiliza para trabajar ofreciendo servicio de transporte público, y del frecuente uso la moto ha presentado algunos desperfecto.  Es por ello que Delia esta solicitando un nuevo crédito, para poder llevar su moto al mecánico y lo deje óptima para seguir trabajando en ella. Ella asegura que el arrendarla es muy perjudicial ya que las personas ajenas no la cuidan como es debido, ahora espera sacar adelante a su familia con los ingresos que recibirá del servicio de transporte que realiza su hijo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y afirma que todos los préstamos que ha recibido la han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Con el crédito que solicita, enviará al mecánico su moto.
texts.en:
Delia, 31, is a widow. She lives with her two children in a house that she owns. When her husband died, she had to struggle alone to support her two children. Since then, she has worked at various jobs and, thanks to her hard work, managed to set up a small general store, a business that she operates in her house. She sells a variety of perishable products such as meat and vegetables. Separately, she used some savings to buy a motocab that she has rented out and that her oldest son uses for a taxi business. The motocab has been used so much that it is now in need of repairs. It's for that purpose that Delia is applying for a loan. She wants a mechanic to repair the motocab so that she can continue to use it. She says that renting the motocab has been a difficult business because renters don't take good care of it. She now hopes to help her family with income from her son's taxi service. This is Delia's third MFP loan and she says that past loans have helped her to improve both her quality of life and that of her family. She will use the loan to repair her motocab.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motocab for taxi business.

loans.name: Valentin Vidal

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito pesquero de San José, ubicado dentro de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas diez años a la comercialización de pescado seco – salado, el adquiere pescado fresco a los pescadores de la zona y luego la procesa en la playa, cuando el producto ya se encuentra listo lo vende a los diversos comerciantes que ofrecen este producto en los mercados de la zona, a veces también sus vecinos llegan a su casa para adquirir su mercadería.

Valentín nos cuenta que esta actividad le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia durante las temporadas de veda ya que su actividad principal es la pesca industrial. 

El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado para procesar y de ese modo aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Valentín siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para hacer progresar a su familia. El ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Valentin is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in the fishing district of San José, located in the province of Lambayeque, some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years, he has sold salted dried fish, acquiring fresh fish from the zone's fishermen and then processing them on the beach. When the product is ready, he sells it to diverse merchants who offer his fish in regional markets, At times, his neighbors also come to his house to acquire his merchandise. Valentin says that selling salted dried fish helps to pay the family's expenses, including during the closed season, even though his principal activity is industrial fishing. He wants to expand his business by buying more fish to process and in this way, to augment his sales and earnings. To reach this objective, he has thought it pertinent to request a loan of 2,000 new sols from EDPYME Alternativa. Valentin is always looking for a means of obtaining income to help his family progress. He has already had loans with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRESH FISH FOR PROCESSING AND SALE AS SALTED DRIED FISH

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 58 años edad ella resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, Departamento D. Morazán, vive con el esposo y sus dos nietos, Kenia D. 7 años, Cesar D. 14 años, tiene un negocio D. venta D. comida y pupusas.
Ella venD. almuerzos D. 11:00 am -1:00pm todos los días y D. 6:00pm en adelante ven pupusas (tortilla D. maíz y queso con carne), acompañadas D. bebidas frías y calientes, actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. alimento como son Carne D. pollo, carne D. res, vegetales, queso, maíz, aceite, esto contribuirá a contar con los materiales necesarios para continuar con el negocio y mejorar los ingresos D. esta familia.
Sus sueños en crecer ver crecer los nietos apoyarlos con los estudios, para que estos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 58, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and their two grandchildren. Kenia is seven years old, and Cesar is 14 years old. She has a business selling food and “pupusas” (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and meat). She sells lunch from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m everyday. She sells pupusas, accompanied with hot and cold drinks, starting at 6:00 p.m. She is now requesting a loan to buy materials to make her food. She will buy things like chicken, beef, vegetables, cheese, corn and oil. This will contribute to her having the materials that are necessary to continue in her business and improve the family income. Her dream is to see her grandchildren grow and to support them with their education so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken, beef, vegetables, cheese, corn and oil to make food

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 49-year-old married lady with four children.  

For the past twenty years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  She joined the Amazing Grace group in Faulu Kenya.  In this group, the members save money on weekly basis, share business ideas, and guarantee each other's loans.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to become a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 30 -year-old dairy farmer.  He has been in this business for five years.  He also offers vehicle break-down services for extra income.  

Paul has been an active member of the Thuita Victory group in Faulu Kenya; he attends the weekly meetings regularly and pays his dues well.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a dairy cow for more production.  He dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire a business premise and to buy sweets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Fanny Monserate

texts.es:
Fanny de 47 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), ella tiene un restaurante en su casa, vende comida a los vecinos del sector. 

Hace cuatro años empezó vendiendo almuerzos para poder solventar su hogar, no esta casada y tiene cinco hijos de 28, 27, 23, 21 y 15 años, algunos de ellos les ayudan mientras que ella cocina, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 15h00pm de lunes a viernes. Cocina platos típicos como arroz con pollo, toda clase de sopas. 

Para poder cocinar en mas volumen sus comidas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo una cocina, en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para repartir la comida a empresas.
texts.en:
Fanny, 47-years-old, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil (a suburban zone, surrounded by the Guayaquil marsh). She has a restaurant in her house where she sells food to her neighbors in the area. Four years ago she began selling lunch to be able to pay her home expenses. She's not married and she has five children, 28, 27, 23, 21, and 15 years of age. Some of them help her while she cooks. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. from Monday to Friday. She cooks traditional dishes such as chicken with rice and many different kinds of soups. To be able to cook her food in a greater volume she wants to buy a stove with the loan. In the future she wants to buy a car to distribute her food to companies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stove

loans.name: Pensando En El Futuro 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Georgina is the coordinator of her group, "Pensando en el Futuro" ("Thinking about the Future"). She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and four children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to educate her children and make them good people.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook for her family.

Georgina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for ten years, starting with some savings she had at home. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying industrial sewing machine, bedding and curtains. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, to build her business locally and in the future, to get a car and to have a successful restaurant. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because the program came to her impoverished village and she understand that this could be her answer to get a better life.  Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, bedding and curtains

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El Sr. Simon, vive en la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, por el Barrio los Olivos Zona Santos Dumont, vive con su esposa que es ama de casa y sus cuatros hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en casa familiar. El Sr. Simon tiene la actividad de maestro albañil - pintor, actualmente se encuentra realizando la contrución y pintado de un inmueble, tiene un contrato, el prestamo solicitado sera destinado en la compra de una amoladora para su trabajo, que es de muchas utilidad para cortar fierro, ya que esta recibiendo bastantes solicitudes de trabajos, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para poder llegar a comprarse su lote y constriur su propia casita, es muy trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de toda su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por darle un apoyo.
texts.en:
Señor Simon lives in the city of Santa Cruz near the Los Olivos neighborhood in the Santos Dumont zone. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and their 4 school age children. He lives in the family home. He is a master mason/painter. Currently, he is working on the construction and painting of a building for which he has a contract. He is receiving a lot of requests for work, so he is soliciting a loan to buy a grinder, which is very useful for cutting iron. His goal is to continue working in order to buy a lot where he can build his own house. He is very hard-working, always thinking of the well-being of his family. He is very grateful to the organization for supporting him.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a grinder

loans.name: Angela Dolores

texts.es:
Ángela de 48 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), ella tiene un puesto de venta de legumbres desde hace años para poder mantener a sus 8 hijos. 

Hace años atrás ella comenzo a trabajar vendiendo legumbres para mantener a sus hijos, después de un tiempo compro una “tricimoto” (moto con un carrito de carga atrás) para que sus hijos vendieran con ella, poco a poco fue incrementando su  capital de trabajo. Ahora ella tiene dos tricimoto y un puesto de venta de legumbres, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. 

Para tener mas oportunidades de venta ella quiere comprar con el préstamo legumbres y vegetales, en el futuro quiere un carro para vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Ángela lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil (suburban area surrounded by the estuary of Guayaquil). She has a stall from which she has sold legumes for many years to support her eight children. After she did this work for a while, she bought a "tricimoto" (motorbike which pulls a small cart), so that her children could work with her. Little by little she increased her working capital. Now she has two "tricimotos" and a stall for selling legumes. She works every day from six in the morning until ten at night. In order to have more opportunities, she wants to use this loan to buy legumes and vegetables. In the future, she would like to have a large cart to enable her to sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Legumes, vegetables

loans.name: Las Golondrinas De Chajabal Group

texts.es: Doña Adelaida es Madre Soltera, cursó el tercer grado Básico, tiene un hijo de ocho años y ella cubre todos los gastos necesarios de su hijo, ella se dedica a la Tejeduría, (Elaboración del Cortes Típicos), tiene 11 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación, convoca a algunas de sus vecinas para organizar un grupo, y poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina LAS GOLONDRINAS DE CHAJABAL, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes y también incluye el nombre de la ubicación. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar, la crianza de animales, tejeduría, y venta de artículos de consumo diario.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Ya que una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante y espera que su negocio sea más grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adelaida is a single mother who has finished the third level of basic education. She has an eight year old son for whose expenses she is completely responsible. She is a weaver and for the past 11 years has created a business making traditional textiles. Relying on enthusiasm and the drive to improve, she called together some of her neighbors to organize a group in order to be able to solicit a loan. The communal bank is called LAS GOLONDRINAS DE CHAJABAL (The Swallows of Chajabal). The name was elected by all the members and also includes the name of the group’s location. The group consists of 11 women members who dedicate themselves to various activities including animal husbandry, weaving, and selling basic necessities. The loan will be used to buy primary material and in this way increase the volume of sales. One of the difficulties of owning a business is lack of capital, however Adelaida has been able to continue forward and she hopes that her business will be bigger and more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lester Ivan

texts.es:
Lester de 35 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Maria Teresa Perez con quien tiene 2 niños, su esposa tiene un pequeño negocio de comideria donde obtiene ingresos para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Lester trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 15 años, desempeñandose como  Operador del Kiosko Cultural. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda reparando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder darle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones necesarias para que vivan en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Lester is 35 years old and married. He has two children with his wife, Maria Teresa Perez, who has a small food-selling business which provides her with income to help with the household expenses. Lester has worked for the Municipality of Juigalpa for the past 15 years as the operator of a cultural information booth. He is requesting his third loan with the aim of improving his home by repairing the roof, which is currently in poor condition. His greatest dream is to be able to give his family a home which provides them with a comfortable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the roof of his home

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 54 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y su pequeña hija de 8 años en su casa propia, pues sus hijos mayores son independientes y viven separados de ella. Hace más de 6 años trabaja vendiendo verduras, en un pequeño puesto dentro de un mercado situado en el distrito de Chancay. Desde ahí ofrece sus productos desde muy temprano en la mañana, lo cual le resulta rentable y tranquilo. Este trabajo le da satisfacción pues una persona que le gusta el comercio, aunque a veces le es cansado, por tener que traer la mercadería desde su casa a su puesto, pero felizmente su pequeña hija la ayuda en el negocio. Ella espera en un futuro poder seguir implementando y ampliando su puesto, para así lograr mejores ventas y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Es su tercer crédito con MFP y se caracteriza por ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, y con ello espera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 54 years old and shares her life with her husband and her eight year old daughter. They live in their own home. She also has adult children who are independent and live apart from her. For more than six years, Isabel has been selling vegetables from a small market stand in the district of Chancay. There she begins offering her products early in the morning, resulting in a profitable and peaceful business. Her work provides her satisfaction since she is a person who enjoys selling. Sometimes she gets tired from having to carry her merchandise from her house to her stand, but happily her young daughter helps with the business. In the future, she hopes to continue operating and expanding her business so that she can improve her sales and move her family forward.

This is her third loan with MFP. Isabel is known for being prompt with all of her payments. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise in hopes of improving her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more perishable products to increase her sales

loans.name: Manos Telarañas Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. SUSY MARLENE TIENE 46 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA, SU ESPOSO LA APOYA ECONÓMICAMENTE Y MORALMENTE EN TODOS LOS PROYECTOS QUE ELLA EMPREND.. TIENEN  TRES HIJOS D. LOS CUALES UNO ES MENOR D. EDAD. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MANOS TELARAÑAS" FORMADO POR 8 PERSONAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON COMO FISCAL D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. SUSY MARLENE SE DEDICA AL TEJIDO D. CHOMPAS, CHALECOS, POLOS, ETC DESD. HACE UN AÑO, INICIÓ REUNIENDOSE CON UN GRUPO D. AMIGAS QUE TENÍAN LA MISMA HABILIDAD Y QUE AHORA OFRECEN SUS TEJIDOS A DIFERENTE PÚBLICO EN UNA FORMA ORGANIZADA BAJO EL NOMBRE D. LLYKA MAKI.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO ELLA PUED. APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y HA LLEGADO A EXPORTAR SUS TEJIDOS.
CON EL PRÉSTAMO OBTENIDO COMPRARÁ LANA A PRECIO POR MAYOR PARA PODER OBTENER UN POCO MAS D. GANANCIA AL VENDER SUS TEJIDOS.
texts.en:
Sra. Susy Marlene is 46 years old and married. Her husband provides her with financial and moral support in all the projects she undertakes. They have three children, one of whom is still a dependent. Susy is a member of the group “Manos Telarañas” (Delicate Hands), which consists of eight individuals who live in the district of Carabayllo. Her fellow members elected her to the group’s Board of Directors as the rules administrator.

Sra. Susy Marlene has been producing woven sweaters, vests, shirts, and other articles for one year. She started meeting with a group of friends who possessed the same skills. Now they sell their woven products in different public places as a formal organization that goes by the name “Llyka Maki”. Thanks to her work, Susy is able to help her husband with the family expenses and export her merchandise.

With this loan, Susy plans to buy wool at the wholesale price so that she C. earn little bit more profit when selling her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for producing woven garments

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es:
Norma tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre soltera, y tiene un hijo. ResiD. en el sector Las Brisas D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo, una ciudad D. bastante movimiento comercial y D. transporte.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a L. comercialización D. ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños en su domicilio, elL. adquiere su mercadería en los centros comerciales mayoristas D. L. región y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos, Norma nos comenta que empezó ofreciendo su mercadería por pedidos y que poco a poco ha logrado tener una clienteL. estable que siempre acuD. a elL. para solicitarles las prendas que ofrece.

Norma desea ampliar su negocio con L. compra D. más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que contribuyan con el logro D. su meta.

ElL. es una mujer luchadora, a pesar D. su condición D. madre soltera ha sabido salir adelante y ahora quiere seguir trabajando para mejorar gradualmente su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old, a single mother with one child. She lives in the Las Brisas sector of the city of Chiclayo, a city with a fair amount of commercial traffic and transportation. For the last five years she has been making a living selling undergarments for women, men and children in her home. She gets her merchandise at the commercial centers of the region and sells it to her neighbors and acquaintances. Norma tells us that she started selling her products from orders and little by little has been able to get a repeat customer base that request the garments that she offers. Norma wants to expand her business with the purchase of merchandise that will increase her sales and give her more profit, this is the reason for her loan request of 1000 new soles, the first one with Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very go-getting woman. In spite of her being a single mother, she has been able to get ahead and now wants to continue working to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of undergarment merchandise to expand the sales business.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años cultiva hortalizas, principalmente brócoli y coliflor, por ser vegetales muy cotizados y mejor renumerados en el mercado. Es por ello que se esfuerzan en la siembra de estos productos, tanto su esposo y sus hijos siempre están al pendiente en cada proceso que requiere estos cultivos, desde que son sembrados hasta la cosecha, en donde contrata operarios para éste último proceso en donde se encargan de la recolección. Una vez cosechado, son vendidos directamente en el mercado de su zona, asimismo son llevados a otras ciudades cercanas para ampliar su mercado. Durante este tiempo, ha visto mejoras en su economía debido a las rentas que recibe son buenas y la tierra que posee se mantiene con los mismos nutrientes, necesarios para los próximos cultivos. En adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos aumentando sus extensiones de terreno que tiene. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que son gestoras del préstamo, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago de mantenimiento mecánico de su carro, que le sirve para transportar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Edita is 36 years old and lives in her home with her husband and three children. For more than three years she has been growing vegetables, especially broccoli and cauliflower, since these are highly prized goods that earn good prices at the market. For this reason, she puts the effort into planting these crops. Her husband and children are always monitoring each step that is required to grow each product, from planting through harvest. She hires workers for the final process which involves collecting everything that is ready for harvest. Once everything is collected Edita sells her products directly at the local market, but she also takes them to other cities nearby to expand her customer base. During the whole time she has been farming, Edita has seen improvements in her finances because her profits have been good and her land has maintained its fertility season after season. In order to keep improving her crops, she wants to expand by acquiring more land.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Edita is very happy to know she has financial support, which is why she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. She is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Edita thanks those individuals who will be approving this loan since it will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance of the vehicle she uses for transporting her products to other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of the vehicle she uses for transporting her products

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha de 48 años de edad es soltera, tiene un hijo; trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, desempeñandose como  Directora de Finanzas. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de reparar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa que esta en malas condiciones y poniendole perlines y zinc nuevo, ya que con el invierno se estan mojando algunas partes de su casa.   

Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda bonita ya que es el patrimonio que dajara a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old, single, and has one child. She has worked for the City of Juigalpa for nine years as the Director of Finance.

She is requesting her third loan so that she can repair her home by replacing the roof which is in bad condition. Martha plans to install crossbeams and new sheets of zinc roofing. Since it is the winter season, moisture has seeped into some parts of her home.

Her greatest wish is to have a beautiful home that she can leave as an inheritance to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his maize crops.

loans.name: Carla Ninosca

texts.es:
Karla de 37 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 10 años, desempeñandose como  Resp. Depto. Fiscalizacion. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un anexo en su vivienda para poder brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia. 

Su mayor sueño es poder ir poco a poco acondicionando su casa ya que es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla is 37 years old, single, and has two children. She has worked the past ten years for the City of Juigalpa as an auditor.

She is requesting her first loan to build an extension to her home in order to provide greater comfort for her family. Her greatest wish is to gradually renovate her house so that she can leave it as an inheritance for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build an extension to her house

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro García es un señor  de 56 años de edad el  cual vive con su esposa y tres hijos  en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Alejandro  y su familia siempre se han  dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad, y hoy en sus productos se venden a buen precio en especial la Leche

El considera que gracias al progreso de este negocio él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y espera seguir haciéndolo.

Actualmente don Alejandro   desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢609.000 (seiscientos nueve   mil colones), para comprar  vacas aumentadas con el fin  incrementar la producción de leche. El sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Pero esta seguro saldrá adelante

Alejandro  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y asegura estar muy feliz de ser socio de este tipo de organizaciones ya que le ofrecerá las herramientas necesarias para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Alejandro García is a 56 year old man living with his wife and three children in Hernández, a community located in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province; this mountain area community, characterized by beautiful sceneries and a high humidity rate, is located along a highway and very close to the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are stockbreeding and agriculture, notably the sowing of basic grains, tubers and oranges. Alejandro and his family have always engaged in cattle farming making the most of both the meat and the milk productions. He thinks this is a good activity as the demand is fairly high in the community, and his products, milk in particular, are currently selling very well. He believes that he and his family have improved their life conditions little by little thanks to the progressing of this activity, and he hopes to keep on doing so. Alejandro is actually requesting a loan of 609.000 Costa Rican colones to buy impregnated cows in order to increase his milk production. He knows that owing a higher number of cows means more sacrifices and will require more work, but he is certain he will get by. Alejandro is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo (United for Development Communal Bank), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan: he is very happy to be a member of this kind of organization, as it will offer him the tools he needs to reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle-

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María de 43 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, rodeada del estero de Guayaquil), tiene una tienda pequeña, afuera de su casa. 

María comenzó vendiendo comida pero como no le fue bien y decidió comprar víveres. Poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo completar dinero para comprar vitrinas y mas víveres. Ahora uno de sus hijos le ayuda atendiendo en la tienda.  Vende bebidas, enlatados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, arroz, bebidas etc. En el futuro quiere tener otro negocio como una papelería.
texts.en:
María Angelica is 43 years old, she lives in Guayaquil, near the motorway called La Perimetral (a periurban zone surrounded by the Guayaquil swamp), and she runs a small shop outside her house. María started selling meals but it didn’t turn out well for her and so she decided to buy provisions. Little by little and thanks to her efforts she was able to earn enough money to buy display cabinets and more provisions. One of her children is currently helping her running the shop, where she sells drinks, canned goods and so on. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sugar, rice, drinks and so on. In the future she would like to run another activity, such as a stationer’s shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and drinks.

loans.name: La Esperanza Del Valle Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. GARDENIA TIENE 34 AÑOS TIENE UNA HIJA D. 14 AÑOS, QUIEN ES SU INSPIRACIÓN Y ALICIENTE PARA ESFORZARSE Y TRABAJAR CADA DÍA PARA SACARLA ADELANTE Y DARLE LO NECESARIO PARA LLEGAR A SER UNA PROFESIONAL MAS ADELANTE. LA SRA. GARDENIA EN INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "LA ESPERANZA DEL VALLE" FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUIENES VIVEN EN LA URBANIZACIÓN LUCIANA EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE TRES AÑOS LA SRA. GARDENIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. ROPA Y PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA OFRECIENDO A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS; EMPEZÓ VENDIENDO PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA POR CATALOGO, LUEGO SUS MISMOS CLIENTES LE EMPEZARONA HACER PEDIDOS D. ROPA, POR LO QUE SE ANIMÓ A HACERSE D. UN STOCK.
CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO HA PODIDO TENER UN CAPITAL D. TRABAJO, TENER UN STOCK TANTO EN PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA COMO EN LA LINEA D. ROPA.
LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE PONER UN NEGOCIO D. CABINAS D. INTERNET.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRAV D. ROPA D. INVIERNO PARA NIÑOS, JOVENES Y ADULTOS, PARA LO CUAL YA TIENE PEDIDOS.
texts.en:
Sra. Gardenia is 34 years old and has a 14 year old daughter who is her inspiration and incentive to strive and work each day to move forward and proviD. everything necessary so that she can become a professional. She is a member of the group “La Esperanza del Valle” (The Hope of the Valley), which consists of ten individuals who live in the development of Luciana in the district of Carabayllo. Her fellow members elected her to be the treasurer of the group’s Board of Directors.

Sra. Gardenia has been selling clothing and beauty products for three years, offering her goods to relatives and friends. She began selling beauty products through catalogs, but later her customers started placing orders for clothing. This encouraged her to build up an inventory of merchandise. With this business, she will be able to have operating capital to maintain a stock of beauty products as well as clothing. Sometime later on she would like to start another business providing Internet services.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of winter clothing for children, teenagers, and adults since she has already received orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase winter clothing for children, teenagers, and adults

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 45 años de edad, reside en el municipio El Divisadero, Departamento de Morazán, es soltero vive con la madre, una hermana y sobrinas, el vende periódicos.
Hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos, el regularmente se levanta a las 3:00 am a recibir los periódicos de noticias del país, y los comercializa de forma ambulante por la ciudad y zonas cercanas, el está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas periódicos y obtener  ingresos seguir trabajando, la dificultad que él tiene es que sus clientes le cancelan al mes por los periódicos.
Los sueños de Carlos son mejorar la condición económica y de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old and lives in the El Divisavero municipality in the Morazán department. He is single and lives with his mother, sister and nieces. He sells newspapers. He has been selling newspapers for the last eight years. He normally wakes at 3:00 am to get the newspapers and then sells them in the streets of the city and nearby areas. He is requesting a loan to purchase more newspapers to continue working and making more income. The difficulty that he faces is that his customers pay at the end of the month for the newspapers. Carlos dreams of improving the financial condition and quality of life of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of newspapers.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña, se dedico a las labores agrícolas, en la actualidad ésta es su principal fuente de ingreso, es por ello que su familia vela cada día por los terrenos ya cultivados, cuidándolas, aplicando abono y regándolas, procuran además que la plaga de insectos no perjudique las plantaciones y que afectan en la cosecha. Aunque las labores del campo sean arduas, afirma que le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad porque le permite tener siempre disponible el alimento para su familia. El cultivo de hortalizas es lo más rentable que tiene, pero también cultiva papa para aumentar sus ganancias, es por esta razón que desea intensificar sus cultivos, producir en mayor cantidad estos productos ya que ofrecen un buen precio por su venta en el mercado local de su zona. En adelante desea  adquirir más extensiones de terreno donde pueda seguir produciendo más. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, por que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de semillas y compost (tierra preparada) para agregar a sus terrenos y de esa manera mejorar la cosecha de papa y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Clorinda is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home. Since she was a child Clorinda has worked in agriculture, and this is her main source of earnings. Each day her family watches over the cultivated land, looking after the crops, applying fertiliser, watering them, trying to ensure that the plagues of insects don't damage the plants and affect the crop. Although agricultural work is hard, Clorinda affirms that she likes the work a lot because it allows her to be free to feed her family. Vegetable cultivation is the most profitable, producing a large quantity of products that get a good price in the local market in the zone. In the future Clorinda wants to acquire more land where she can continue to produce more. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is very content to know that she has financial support. She has always been responsible with her repayments, and is thankful to be part of a communal bank as all the members are responsible and supportive people. Clorinda is thankful that the members will be guarantors for the loan she is seeking, as it will be very useful for her business. With the loan she is seeking Clorinda plans to invest in the purchase of seeds and compost (prepared earth) to add to her land and in this way improve her potato and vegetable crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and compost

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto A. V. is 36 years old. He lives with his 5 children, aged 5, 8, 12, 15 and 18, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Luis is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Luis is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, corn and beans. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn and beans once a year.

Luis requests this loan to be able to buy compost and seeds for blackberries. He hopes this credit will help him work and move forward with his products. His dream is to have enough to live. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He is also at risk of losing his blackberries with the bad weather they had (heavy rain, frozen cultures…)

He likes to play volleyball in his free time.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds for blackberries

loans.name: Washington Wilfrido

texts.en:
Washington Wilfrido Aguello V. is 34 years old. He lives with his 2 children, aged 10 and 12, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Washington is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Washington is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries and corn. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn once a year(after harvest).

Washington is asking this loan to buy compost and fertilizers (mostly organic ones) for his crops, and for his children studies. He hopes this credit will help him  buy what he needs to work. His dream is to purchase land and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He also faces health problems in his family. 

He likes to play volleyball  and indoor soccer in his free time. 

He would like to learn how to make organic compost. He would also like to be taught how to raise fishes to diversify his production. Finally, he would like to be trained on selling his products more effectively.

loans.use: Buy compost and fertilizers (mostly organic ones) for his crops

loans.name: Tomas Segundo

texts.en:
Tomas Segundo C. I. is 33 years old. He lives with his 3 children, aged 3, 17 and 18, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Tomas is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Tomas is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, beans and potatoes. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and potatoes and beans once a year.

Tomas requests this loan to buy fertilizers (chemical and organic ones). He thinks this credit will help him purchase what he needs. His dream is to buy more land and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers (chemical and organic ones)

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
La Señora. María Paula Y. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, que se encuentra ubicada al sur occidente del cantón Gualaceo, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, lo que producen es para su consumo. La población femenina se dedica al tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al bordado de polleras (faldas) y blusas.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de verduras y plantas medicinales, actividad que la realiza hace 18 años los días martes y viernes, los demás días de la semana se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y la agricultura, sus ventas las realiza en su comunidad o en algún mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca.

La Señora María Paula tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda hace 4 años, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 4 son casados, dos de ellos viven  independientemente y sus otros dos hijos casados viven en su casa y es Doña María quien les ayuda a sus hijos en sus gastos, de sus tres últimos hijos dos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio y una en la escuela, con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Es nuestra socia hace 4 años y  los créditos  la han servido para seguir creciendo en su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado y abono para su potrero.

Su meta es algún día poder mejorar su casita.
texts.en:
María Paula Y. is a member of the Zhidmad Communal Bank, which is to the southwest of the Gualaceo canton. The people there devote themselves to farming and livestock. What they produce is for their consumption. The women weave Panama hats made from the fibers of the “toquilla” plant, make jackets, and embroider “polleras” (skirts) and blouses. Our member sells vegetables and medicinal plants. She has been doing this for 18 years on Tuesdays and Fridays. The other days of the week she devotes to raising chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and to farming. She makes her sales in her community or at a fair in the city of Cuenca. María Paula is 52 years old, and she has been a widow for four years. She has seven children. Four of her children are married, and two of them live independently. Two of her married children live in María’s house. She helps her children with their expenses. Two of the three remaining children are in high school, and one is in elementary school. Through her work and sacrifice she was able to build her own house. She has been a member for four years. The loans have helped her to continue growing in her business. The new loan is to buy livestock and fertilizer for her pasture. Her goal is to one day be able to improve her little house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Tetepelcingo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tetepelcingo, decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama el pueblo donde se encuentra ubicado el grupo y la mayoría del grupo son originarios de ahí, la historia es acerca de Verónica T. D., ya que ella es la representante del grupo, es casada tiene 3 hijos Paola de 9 años estudia la primaria, Ingrid de 3 y un bebe de 5 meses, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos.

Nos comenta que se decidió por este negocio por que dice que en el pueblo donde radica no hay quien venda comida por las tardes, además de que a ella le gusta preparar comida, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como son: aceite, sal, tomates, servilletas, platos, cucharas y chiles para así seguir preparando sus antojitos.

Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio se esta beneficiando mucho por que esta pudiendo sacar a sus hijos adelante, y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y de la educación de sus hijos.

Comenta que con su negocio también esta beneficiando alas personas de su comunidad puesto que como es la única que vende comida ahí, ahora las personas que no tienen tiempo o ganas de preparar comida van con ella para comprar sus alimentos. 

La meta que se ha puesto verónica es darles una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y así tengan una buena profesión, para que tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacerse de un local donde pueda establecerse de manera definitiva y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Nos cuenta que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones, les gusta mucho el trabajo, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad, ya que ellos se conocen de hace tiempo dice que son personas pagadoras, no les gusta defraudar a las personas que depositan su confianza en ellos.
Verónica le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su hija a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos pudo cambiar su vida y la de sus pequeños hijos, puesto que a hora tendrá una mejor educación.

Los integrantes de tetepelcingo y las actividades alas que se dedican cada uno de ellos son las siguientes:
Verónica T. D.-antojitos (REPRESENTANTE)
Marcela Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
Emilia mariana Nicolás-venta de servilletas
Eustolia Nicolás B.-venta de servilletas
Reina R. López-venta de servilletas
Rufina Hernández López-venta de servilletas
Sofía Hernández-venta de servilletas
Victoria López B.-venta de servilletas
Gloria Hernández Nicolás-venta de servilletas
Josefa Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
Demetria Hernández L.-venta de servilletas
texts.en:
This group is called Tetepelcingo. They named themselves after the village where their group is located. The majority of them are natives of this village. This story is about Verónica T. D. as she is the group representative. She is married and has 3 children, Paola, who is 9 years old and is in elementary school, Ingrid, 3, and a baby who is 5 months old. Verónica sells traditional street snacks. She tells us that she started this business because in the village where she lives there isn't anyone who sells food in the afternoons and she likes to prepare food. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy supplies like oil, salt, tomatoes, napkins, plates, utensils and chilies to prepare her dishes. She provides for her children with the earnings from the business and helps her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children. She says that her business is beneficial to her community as well, since she is the only person that sells prepared food here. Now, the people that don't have time or the desire to prepare food, can buy her food. Her goal is to give her children a quality education so that they can have a good profession and a better future. She also wants to set up a permanent local so that she can generate more income. She tells us that all the other members in the group are responsible people that fulfill their obligations. They like to work to overcome and excel given any difficulty. Since they have known each other for a long time, they are committed to repaying their loan. They do not want to let down those that have put their trust in them. On behalf of her and her daughter, Verónica would like to thank FRAC and Kiva because, thanks to them, she could change her life and that of her children since they will have a better education. The members of Tetepelcingo and what each one does for a living are as follows: Verónica T. D. (representative) - prepares and sells traditional snack foods Marcela Hernández L. - Napkin sales Emilia Mariana Nicolás - Napkin sales Eustolia Nicolás B. - Napkin sales Reina R. López - Napkin sales Rufina Hernández López - Napkin sales Sofía Hernández - Napkin sales Victoria López B. - Napkin sales Gloria Hernández Nicolás - Napkin sales Josefa Hernández L. - Napkin sales Demetria Hernández L. - Napkin sales

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as oil, potatoes, chilies, tomatoes, napkins, plates and utensils

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.en:
Jose Alberto A. R. is 39 years old. He is in a common-law relationship and lives with his 2 children, aged 5 and 7, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Jose is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Jose cultivates blackberries, corn and peas. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn and peas once a year.

Jose is asking for this loan to save his crops by enabling him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers. He thinks this credit will help him purchase what he needs, since he lacks the cash to do it without the credit help. His dream is to buy more land and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He lacks money for his family.

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer in his free time

loans.use: To purchase seeds, compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 45 años D. edad resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, es casada vive con el esposo y tiene dos hijos D. las edades de15y 14 años, tiene una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Hace dos años inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia, los hijos le ayudan a vender,  y el esposo trabaja en agricultura, Zoila regularmente atienD. el negocio en horario D. 6:00am-7:00pm, le va muy bien en las ventas, pero se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar un préstamo que le permita adquirir productos como son: aceite, café, azúcar, leche en polvo, frijoles, arroz y otros productos que le demandan los clientes.
Las aspiraciones D. Zoila son Ampliar el negocio, apoyar a los hijos, mejorar las condiciones económicas D. la familia,
texts.en:
Zoila is 45 years old and lives in Concepción Batres, within the Usulután department. She is married, lives with her husband and has two children, ages 15 and 14. She has a store where she sells basic needs products and started her business two years ago and on her own initiative. Her children would help her to sell and her husband worked in agriculture. Zoila normally attends to business from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm. Her sales have been doing well, but she has seen the need to request a loan so that she can buy items such as: cooking oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, beans, rice, and other products that her requested by her customers. Her aspirations are to expand her business, support her children, and improve her family’s economic status.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: William Gonzalo

texts.en:
William Gonzalo V. S. is 44 years old. He is in a common-law relationship, and lives with his 4 children, aged 5, 9, 14 and 15, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

William is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

William is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, beans and corn. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn and beans once a year.

William requests this loan to invest in blackberries by purchasing seeds and compost. His dream is to get a house and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and compost for blackberries

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos de dos y cinco años de edad en el sector Las Delicias, una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, distrito agrícola situado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace mas de diez años, el cría animales menores en su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona frecuentemente y también en una feria que toma lugar todas las semanas en el distrito de Cayaltí (a mas de media hora desde donde vive), con esta actividad ha podido ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Daniel desea ampliar sus ingresos incursionando en el negocio de transporte de carga y pasajeros, el ha estado ahorrando dinero producto de su negocio para adquirir una mototaxi (motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina para brindar servicios de transporte) la cual le permitirá obtener nuevos ingresos para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Actualmente desea completar la suma que necesita para lograr su objetivo, por este motivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Daniel es una persona bastante trabajadora y honesta, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro mejor, para lograrlo, se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 36 year old family man living with his wife and their two children aged 2 and 5. They live in Las Delicias, a rural sector of the agricultural district of Oyotún, located two hours away from the town of Chiclayo. He has been engaging in the breeding and selling of animals for more than ten years: he breeds small animals in his house and then sells them to shopkeepers that frequently visit the area, as well as in a weekly fair in the Cayaltí district (more than half an hour away from where he lives). Thanks to this activity he has succeeded in providing for his family. Daniel wishes to increase his earnings venturing into passenger and cargo transportation services. He has been saving money from his current activity to buy a Moto taxi (a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to offer transportation services): this will allow him to make more money to help his family getting ahead. As his current wish is to collect the sum he needs to reach his goal, he has requested a loan of 2000 PEN to Edpyme Alternativa. Daniel is a hardworking and honest person: his main goal is to give to his children the chance to have a better future, and he means to arduously work to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a Moto taxi to offer transportation services in his area.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 30 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 8 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa y también alfalfa, ya que es necesaria para la alimentación de cuyes que tiene y que están cercadas en un espacio dentro de la casa de su padre. Asimismo posee vacas, en donde extrae la leche que diariamente vende. Estos ingresos le sirven para poder sostener a su familia y también invertir en sus chacras, con el fin de aumentar su producción. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su padre, pero generalmente lo hace sola, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha, ya que la venta de cuyes y papa va en aumento, ante esto trata de sembrar variedad de papa ya que es más rentable. Sus planes es  industrializar su granja de cuyes y tener más extensiones de terreno. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece además aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de madera y rejillas de metal para ampliar su granja con nuevos galpones de cuyes y sacos de abono para sembrar papa y alfalfa.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. She’s been farming for eight years; raising potatoes. She also raises alfalfa, which she needs to feed her Guinea pigs, which she raises in a dedicated area at her father’s home. She also has cows which produce milk that she sells each day. This income helps to support her family and also allows her to invest into her land in order to increase her production. She sometimes gets help from her father, but she usually does the work herself. It makes her feel very satisfied, especially because her sales of Guinea pigs and potatoes are increasing. She tries to plant more varieties of potatoes because it’s more profitable. Her goals are to industrialize her Guinea pig farm and acquire more extensions to her land. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has some financial backing. She has proven to be responsible in making her payments and she really enjoys being part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. She also very much appreciates the people who will make this loan possible, which will be very helpful to her business. She will use the money from this loan to buy lumber and metal fencing in order to expand her farm with new sheds for her Guinea pigs. She will also buy sacs of fertilizer in order to plant more potatoes and alfalfa.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming supplies
